content:
TITLE: Installing cdxgen Globally via npm - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs the cdxgen package globally using npm, making the CLI accessible system-wide. Requires Node.js and npm to be pre-installed on the target system. No additional configuration is necessary and process runs with sudo privileges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/CLI.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying cdxgen Commands and Options
DESCRIPTION: This text block displays the available commands and options for the cdxgen tool. It provides information on output file specification, project type selection, recursion mode, dependency resolution, server mode configuration, and various other features related to SBOM generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
cdxgen [command]

Commands:
  cdxgen completion  Generate bash/zsh completion

Options:
  -o, --output                 Output file. Default bom.json                                       [default: "bom.json"]
  -t, --type                   Project type. Please refer to https://cyclonedx.github.io/cdxgen/#/PROJECT_TYPES for supp
                               orted languages/platforms.                                                        [array]
      --exclude-type           Project types to exclude. Please refer to https://cyclonedx.github.io/cdxgen/#/PROJECT_TY
                               PES for supported languages/platforms.
  -r, --recurse                Recurse mode suitable for mono-repos. Defaults to true. Pass --no-recurse to disable.
                                                                                               [boolean] [default: true]
  -p, --print                  Print the SBOM as a table with tree.                                            [boolean]
  -c, --resolve-class          Resolve class names for packages. jars only for now.                            [boolean]
      --deep                   Perform deep searches for components. Useful while scanning C/C++ apps, live OS and oci i
                               mages.                                                                          [boolean]
      --server-url             Dependency track url. Eg: https://deptrack.cyclonedx.io
      --skip-dt-tls-check      Skip TLS certificate check when calling Dependency-Track.      [boolean] [default: false]
      --api-key                Dependency track api key
      --project-group          Dependency track project group
      --project-name           Dependency track project name. Default use the directory name
      --project-version        Dependency track project version                                   [string] [default: ""]
      --project-id             Dependency track project id. Either provide the id or the project name and version togeth
                               er                                                                               [string]
      --parent-project-id      Dependency track parent project id                                               [string]
      --required-only          Include only the packages with required scope on the SBOM. Would set compositions.aggrega
                               te to incomplete unless --no-auto-compositions is passed.                       [boolean]
      --fail-on-error          Fail if any dependency extractor fails.                                         [boolean]
      --no-babel               Do not use babel to perform usage analysis for JavaScript/TypeScript projects.  [boolean]
      --generate-key-and-sign  Generate an RSA public/private key pair and then sign the generated SBOM using JSON Web S
                               ignatures.                                                                      [boolean]
      --server                 Run cdxgen as a server                                                          [boolean]
      --server-host            Listen address                                                     [default: "127.0.0.1"]
      --server-port            Listen port                                                             [default: "9090"]
      --install-deps           Install dependencies automatically for some projects. Defaults to true but disabled for c
                               ontainers and oci scans. Use --no-install-deps to disable this feature.
                                                                                               [boolean] [default: true]
      --validate               Validate the generated SBOM using json schema. Defaults to true. Pass --no-validate to di
                               sable.                                                          [boolean] [default: true]
      --evidence               Generate SBOM with evidence for supported languages.           [boolean] [default: false]
      --spec-version           CycloneDX Specification version to use. Defaults to 1.6           [number] [default: 1.6]
      --filter                 Filter components containing this word in purl or component.properties.value. Multiple va
                               lues allowed.                                                                     [array]
      --only                   Include components only containing this word in purl. Useful to generate BOM with first p
                               arty components alone. Multiple values allowed.                                   [array]
      --author                 The person(s) who created the BOM. Set this value if you're intending the modify the BOM
                               and claim authorship.                               [array] [default: "OWASP Foundation"]
      --profile                BOM profile to use for generation. Default generic.
  [choices: "appsec", "research", "operational", "threat-modeling", "license-compliance", "generic", "machine-learning",
                                                       "ml", "deep-learning", "ml-deep", "ml-tiny"] [default: "generic"]
      --exclude                Additional glob pattern(s) to ignore                                              [array]
      --include-formulation    Generate formulation section with git metadata and build tools. Defaults to false.
                                                                                              [boolean] [default: false]
      --include-crypto         Include crypto libraries as components.                        [boolean] [default: false]
      --standard               The list of standards which may consist of regulations, industry or organizational-specif
                               ic standards, maturity models, best practices, or any other requirements which can be eva
                               luated against or attested to.
  [array] [choices: "asvs-5.0", "asvs-4.0.3", "bsimm-v13", "masvs-2.0.0", "nist_ssdf-1.1", "pcissc-secure-slc-1.1", "scv
                                                                                         s-1.0.0", "ssaf-DRAFT-2023-11"]
      --json-pretty            Pretty-print the generated BOM json.                           [boolean] [default: false]
      --min-confidence         Minimum confidence needed for the identity of a component from 0 - 1, where 1 is 100% con
                               fidence.                                                            [number] [default: 0]
      --technique              Analysis technique to use
  [array] [choices: "auto", "source-code-analysis", "binary-analysis", "manifest-analysis", "hash-comparison", "instrume
                                                                                                   ntation", "filename"]
      --auto-compositions      Automatically set compositions when the BOM was filtered. Defaults to true
                                                                                               [boolean] [default: true]
  -h, --help                   Show help                                                                       [boolean]
  -v, --version                Show version number                                                             [boolean]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Minimal SBOM
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates the minimal usage of cdxgen to generate an SBOM. It creates a `bom.json` file in the current directory with default settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning a Docker/OCI Image from a Tar File
DESCRIPTION: Provides a sequence of commands to first save a Docker or Podman image to a tar file and then use cdxgen to generate an SBOM from that saved image file. This is useful for scanning images without direct registry access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker pull shiftleft/scan-slim
docker save -o /tmp/slim.tar shiftleft/scan-slim
podman save -q --format oci-archive -o /tmp/slim.tar shiftleft/scan-slim
cdxgen /tmp/slim.tar -o /tmp/bom.json -t docker
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate SBOM for a container image by digest
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SBOM for a container image using its SHA256 digest.  The `docker` type is automatically detected based on the presence of `sha256` or `docker.io` in the image path.  The output is saved to bom.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen odoo@sha256:4e1e147f0e6714e8f8c5806d2b484075b4076ca50490577cdf9162566086d15e -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Visualizing SBOM Workflow with Mermaid Diagram
DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid diagram defines an end-to-end workflow of generating an SBOM using cdxgen from various inputs (source code, container images, or binary artifacts), and demonstrates associated use cases such as build breaking, vulnerability management, and license compliance. The diagram assists in understanding dependency relationships and process flow; it requires Mermaid.js to render and interpret.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/CLI.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
flowchart LR
    A[Source Code] --> B([fa:fa-terminal cdxgen])
    A1[Container Image] --> B([fa:fa-terminal cdxgen])
    A2[Binary Artifact] --> B([fa:fa-terminal cdxgen])
    B --> C(fa:fa-file SBOM)---|fa:fa-hashtag Sign| C
    C --> D{Use Cases}
    subgraph BOM Use Cases
      D -->|Break build| E[fa:fa-shield Invoke depscan]
      D -->|Vulnerability Management| F[fa:fa-shield-halved Dependency Track]
      D -->|License Compliance| G[fa:fa-rectangle-list Dependency Track]
    end
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Data Flow Evidence using evinse
DESCRIPTION: Uses evinse to compute data-flow based call stack evidence using a 'Reverse-Reachability' algorithm on an existing SBOM (`bom.json`). This is useful when standard reachability is unreliable. The output is saved to `bom.evinse.json`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
evinse -i bom.json -o bom.evinse.json --with-data-flow <path to the application>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Usage Evidence from a Cache-Generated SBOM
DESCRIPTION: Uses evinse to find evidence of direct component usage in an application, based on an SBOM previously generated from a Maven or Gradle cache. Optionally, `--with-data-flow` can be added for deeper analysis (time-consuming). Requires the application to be compiled/built first.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# compile or build your application
evinse -i <bom from cache> -o bom.evinse.json <application path>
# Generate data-flow evidence (Takes a while)
# evinse -i <bom from cache> -o bom.evinse.json --with-data-flow <application path>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Python SBOM with Reachability Evidence using cdxgen
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for a Python application including reachability-based call stack evidence. Requires navigating to the application directory and running cdxgen in deep mode (`--deep`). The SBOM is saved to `bom.json`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd <path to the application>
cdxgen -t python --deep -o bom.json --evidence .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate SBOM for a Java project
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SBOM specifically for a Java project. cdxgen automatically detects the build system (Maven, Gradle, or SBT) and generates the BOM accordingly.  The output is saved to bom.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t java -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate SBOM for an older specification version
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SBOM adhering to an older specification version, such as 1.4.  The `--spec-version` argument specifies the desired specification version, which is particularly useful for maintaining compatibility with older systems or tools.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -r -o bom.json --spec-version 1.4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recursively generate a single SBOM for all languages
DESCRIPTION: This command recursively generates a single SBOM for a multi-language project. The `-r` argument enables recursive scanning of subdirectories, and the output is written to bom.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -r -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying CycloneDX Specification Version
DESCRIPTION: These shell commands generate recursive SBOMs using specific CycloneDX specification versions. The `--spec-version` argument is used to specify the desired version (1.6 and 1.4). Note that some tools might not support version 1.6.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# 1.6 is unsupported by most tools
cdxgen -r -o bom.json --spec-version 1.6

# 1.4 is supported by most tools
cdxgen -r -o bom.json --spec-version 1.4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Recursive SBOM
DESCRIPTION: This shell command generates a single SBOM for all languages found in a mono-repo. The `-r` option enables recursive mode, and the output is saved to `bom.json`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -r -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate OBOM (Operating System BOM)
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an OBOM (Operating System Bill of Materials) for the current system.  `obom` is an alias for `cdxgen -t os`. This command uses osquery to detect installed software, hardware components, and other system information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# obom is an alias for cdxgen -t os
obom
# cdxgen -t os
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Docker - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Runs the cdxgen CLI as a containerized application using Docker. The command mounts directories for input and output, and supports usage of multiple cdxgen versions or deno-based images. Requires Docker to be installed and the specified paths to exist; outputs the generated SBOM to the target directory. Substitute image tags, output paths, or input directories as required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/CLI.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:v8.6.0 -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-deno -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning bionomia Ruby Repository and Generating SBOM using Docker - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Clones the bionomia Ruby project and uses the cdxgen-debian-ruby33 Docker image to generate an SBOM ('/app/bom.json') with reachable evidence. Requires Docker and git; mounts the project directory and temp directory into the container for processing. The '-r /app' sets the root for SBOM analysis, '-t ruby' specifies Ruby as the project type, and '--profile research' enables advanced evidence collection. cdxgen auto-detects required Ruby version and provides output in JSON format with extended evidence for all included dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON2.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/bionomia/bionomia
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby33:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby --profile research
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Post-Build SBOM for Android APKs
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for Android applications from compiled APK files using cdxgen. Specifies the Android type (`-t android`) and the `post-build` lifecycle phase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t android --lifecycle post-build -o bom.json <path to apks>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Local Path with cdxgen Server using cURL (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to use cURL to send an HTTP GET request to a running cdxgen server (assumed to be on localhost:9090) to generate an SBOM. The request targets the `/sbom` endpoint and uses query parameters to specify the local path to scan (`/Volumes/Work/sandbox/vulnerable-aws-koa-app`), enable multi-project mode (`multiProject=true`), and set the project type to JavaScript (`type=js`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?path=/Volumes/Work/sandbox/vulnerable-aws-koa-app&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install cdxgen globally using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the cdxgen package globally using npm, making it available from any directory in the terminal. This allows users to generate SBOMs from any git repository or container image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing Author Metadata in SBOM using cdxgen
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to override or set the author metadata in the generated SBOM using the `--author` argument with cdxgen. Multiple `--author` arguments can be provided.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen --author "OWASP Foundation" --author "Apache Foundation" -t java ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Post-Build SBOM for Go Binaries
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for Go applications from compiled binaries using cdxgen. Specifies the Go type (`-t go`) and the `post-build` lifecycle phase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t go --lifecycle post-build -o bom.json <path to go binaries>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cdxgen globally with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the cdxgen tool globally using npm, allowing it to be accessed from any directory in the system. It requires Node.js and npm to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON1.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Java 17 Docker Image (shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using the ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17:v11 image, which includes Java 17 and additional build tools like gcc. It mounts volumes for caching dependencies (.m2), the project directory (/app), and a temporary directory (/tmp) to generate an SBOM (bom.json) for the specified project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cdxgen via npm with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to globally install the cdxgen tool using npm, which is necessary for generating SBOMs from JavaScript projects like Juice Shop. It sets up the environment for subsequent SBOM creation commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Java 11 Docker Image (shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using the ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11:v11 image, which includes Java 11 and additional build tools like gcc. It mounts volumes for caching dependencies (.m2), the project directory (/app), and a temporary directory (/tmp) to generate an SBOM (bom.json) for the specified project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cdxgen Binary Plugins
DESCRIPTION: Provides the command to install the optional cdxgen binary plugins globally using npm. These plugins extend cdxgen's capabilities for additional SBOM use cases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen-plugins-bin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for .NET 8.0 (Debian) with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for .NET 8.0 applications using the Debian version, which is recommended for better performance and compatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet8:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Deno (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes the cdxgen tool using the Deno runtime from the main.ts script. This command requires Deno to be installed and grants specific permissions necessary for cdxgen's operation, including reading files, accessing environment variables, running subprocesses, getting system info, writing files, and network access. A path to the target repository must be provided as the final argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/deno/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
deno run --allow-read --allow-env --allow-run --allow-sys=uid,systemMemoryInfo,gid,homedir --allow-write --allow-net main.ts <path to repo>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cdxgen using npm (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet installs the cdxgen tool globally using the npm package manager. It requires Node.js version 20 or greater.  The command uses 'sudo' to install globally which might require elevated privileges. Upon successful execution, the cdxgen command-line tool becomes available for generating SBOMs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON4.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting cdxgen Server Locally with Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the cdxgen tool in server mode using the `--server` flag. By default, it listens on port 9090 on the local host. Further customization is possible with `--server-host` and `--server-port` arguments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen --server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate SBOM for a container image by tag
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SBOM for a container image using its tag.  The `-t docker` option explicitly specifies the project type as Docker. If no tag is specified, the `latest` tag is used by default. The output is written to bom.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen ghcr.io/owasp-dep-scan/depscan:nightly -o bom.json -t docker
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install cdxgen using Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: This command installs cdxgen using Homebrew, a package manager for macOS. It provides an alternative installation method for macOS users, making it easier to manage cdxgen along with other command-line tools.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating SBOM for C/Python Projects
DESCRIPTION: This shell command generates an SBOM for C or Python projects. Ensure Java >= 21 is installed for this to work correctly, because cdxgen utilizes it. The `-t c` option specifies the project type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Install java >= 21
cdxgen -t c -o bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Input Format for CSV File (CSV)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides an example row structure for the input CSV file used by the script. It defines the required headers ('project', 'link', 'commit', 'image', 'language', 'cdxgen_vars') and shows a sample data entry for a project, including the repository URL, a specific commit hash, the cdxgen container image to use, and optional language and cdxgen variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/bulk-generate/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CSV
CODE:
```
project,link,commit,image,language,cdxgen_vars
astro,https://github.com/withastro/astro.git,9d6bcdb88fcb9df0c5c70e2b591bcf962ce55f63,ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-node20:v11,js,,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Evinse Usage after SBOM from Cache
DESCRIPTION: This shows two commands, the first to compile or build your application, and the second to run `evinse` against an SBOM generated from a maven or gradle cache.  The first example shows the command to generate occurrence evidences.  The second, commented out, shows the command to generate data flow evidences. The command assumes a bom file `<bom from cache>` has previously been generated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# compile or build your application
evinse -i <bom from cache> -o bom.evinse.json <application path>
# Generate data-flow evidence (Takes a while)
# evinse -i <bom from cache> -o bom.evinse.json --with-data-flow <application path>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using default cdxgen image with type node20 for SBOM generation
DESCRIPTION: This command runs cdxgen container without specifying a custom Node.js version, instead instructing it to install Node.js version 20 via the `-t node20` argument, ensuring compatibility with Juice Shop's dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -e "NPM_INSTALL_ARGS=--package-lock --legacy-peer-deps" -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:latest -t node20 -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using nerdctl with default cdxgen image for SBOM creation
DESCRIPTION: This is the nerdctl equivalent of the previous command, running the cdxgen container with Node.js 20 support to generate an SBOM for the project directory, compatible with systems using nerdctl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
nerdctl run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -e "NPM_INSTALL_ARGS=--package-lock --legacy-peer-deps" -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:latest -t node20 -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Podman Socket for Rootless/Remote Mode
DESCRIPTION: Provides shell commands necessary to enable and start the Podman user socket, which is required for cdxgen to interact with Podman when running in rootless or remote modes on Linux.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
systemctl --user enable --now podman.socket
systemctl --user start podman.socket
podman system service -t 0 &
```

TITLE: Generating ML-profile SBOM for AI-driven analysis
DESCRIPTION: This command executes cdxgen with the `--profile ml` argument, creating a specialized SBOM designed for AI or ML applications, which may take longer to generate. It is intended for datasets or training ML models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -e "NPM_INSTALL_ARGS=--package-lock --legacy-peer-deps" -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-node20:latest -t js --profile ml -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for .NET 9.0 applications using the SLE version, which requires specifying the amd64 platform.

docker run --rm --platform=linux/amd64 -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet9:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet

TITLE: Running cdxgen Server in Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: This bash command runs cdxgen in server mode within a Docker container. It maps port 9090, mounts the current directory as `/app`, and specifies the recursive scan option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -p 9090:9090 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen -r /app --server --server-host 0.0.0.0
```

TITLE: Generating Java SBOM with Reachability Evidence using cdxgen
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for a Java application including reachability-based call stack evidence. Requires navigating to the application directory and running cdxgen in deep mode (`--deep`). The SBOM is saved to `bom.json`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd <path to the application>
cdxgen -t java --deep -o bom.json --evidence .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen in Server Mode
DESCRIPTION: This shell command starts cdxgen in server mode, allowing it to be accessed via HTTP requests. By default, it listens on port 9090.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen --server
```

TITLE: Generating SBOM for JavaScript Application using cdxgen - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Runs cdxgen to generate an SBOM ('bom.json') with reachable evidence for a JavaScript application using the research profile. Assumes 'frontend' repo is cloned, dependencies installed via 'npm install', and cdxgen is available. Key parameters: '-o bom.json' (output file), '-t js' (JavaScript target), '--profile research' (advanced evidence), '.' (current directory), '-p' (parallel processing). Produces a detailed SBOM including occurrence and call stack details for dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON2.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd frontend
npm install
# Takes around 5 mins
cdxgen -o bom.json -t js --profile research . -p
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Git Repository via POST Request (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Provides a Python example using the `requests` library to send a POST request to the `cdxgen` server. It constructs a JSON payload including the repository `url` (with authentication), optional `serverUrl` and `apiKey` for Dependency-Track integration, and project details (`projectId`, `projectName`, `projectVersion`, `parentUUID`). Requires the `requests` library to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import requests
data = {
    "url": f"https://user:{github_api_key}@github.com/{organization}/{repository}.git",
    "serverUrl": dependencytrack_api_url,
    "apiKey": dependencytrack_api_key
    "projectId": project_uuid,
    "projectName": project_name,
    "projectVersion": project_version,
    "parentUUID": parent_uuid
}
response = requests.post(url=cdxgen_server_url, json=data, allowed_retries=0)
```

TITLE: Generating an OBOM (Operating System BOM)

SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
obom
cdxgen -t os
```

TITLE: Evinse SBOM Generation for Java
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM with evidence for a Java project using `evinse`. It takes an input SBOM file (`bom.json`) and outputs a new SBOM file with evidence (`bom.evinse.json`).  The `<path to the application>` argument specifies the location of the application source code. Java >= 21 must be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
evinse -i bom.json -o bom.evinse.json <path to the application>
```

TITLE: Controlling external command permissions with CDXGEN_NODE_OPTIONS
DESCRIPTION: This shell command sets the `CDXGEN_NODE_OPTIONS` environment variable to control the permissions for external node-based commands like npm and yarn.  It allows for more granular control over the permissions granted to these commands. It's important to restrict permissions as much as possible.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/PERMISSIONS.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export CDXGEN_NODE_OPTIONS="--permission --allow-fs-read<more restricted directories> --allow-fs-write=/foo/usages.slices.json"
```

TITLE: Scan a git repo using cURL
DESCRIPTION: This command uses cURL to send a request to the cdxgen server to scan a git repository. It specifies the git repository URL, enables multi-project mode, and sets the project type to JavaScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Python Reachability Evidence with Caching
DESCRIPTION: Uses evinse to compute reachability evidence for Python projects (`-l python`), utilizing cached usages and reachables files for improved performance on subsequent runs. Input SBOM is `bom.json`, output is `bom.evinse.json`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
evinse -i bom.json -o bom.evinse.json --usages-slices-file usages.json --reachables-slices-file reachables.json -l python --with-reachables <path to the application>
```

TITLE: Generating Data Flow Evidence for JavaScript/TypeScript with Caching
DESCRIPTION: Uses evinse to compute data-flow evidence for JavaScript or TypeScript projects, specifying the language (`-l javascript`) and utilizing caching for performance. Input SBOM is `bom.json`, output is `bom.evinse.json`, and cache files are specified.

TITLE: Specifying Package Requirements with SHA256 Hashes
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to define Python package requirements with SHA256 hashes for verification during installation. It uses the `--hash` flag to specify the expected hash of the package file.  This prevents installing tampered packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
torchtext==0.15.2+cpu ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.12" and (sys_platform == "linux" or sys_platform == "darwin") \
    --hash=sha256:08faa135ec6eaf57ab252708b9fed7005088bd57aafd67f7974fda45d28df0fa \
    --hash=sha256:483e5822a1d187043ee7c9ab7e61d42eb00621396b4053590105c3b5fff1edef \
    --hash=sha256:48fe6e6178bc3345798e2e61d27218bd55df9a2a312aff42e74fa92046542072 \
    --hash=sha256:78088ad4bb5fb1001bb1b07471344e4c134090da29a40d43f7230f697cc1dfe9
```

TITLE: Setting NODE_OPTIONS for cdxgen
DESCRIPTION: This shell command sets the NODE_OPTIONS environment variable to grant file system read/write and child process permissions for cdxgen. It allows cdxgen to access necessary files and execute commands. It requires understanding the file system structure of the environment where cdxgen is running.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/PERMISSIONS.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export NODE_OPTIONS='--permission --allow-fs-read="/home/almalinux/work*" --allow-fs-write="/tmp/*" --allow-child-process'
node bin/cdxgen.js -o /tmp/bom.json /home/almalinux/work/sandbox/vuln-spring -t java
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating, Signing, and Attaching SBOM to Container Image with cdxgen and ORAS
DESCRIPTION: Generates and signs an SBOM for the specified container image using 'cdxgen' with a generated key, saving output as 'bom.json'. Then, it attaches the SBOM as an artifact of type 'sbom/cyclonedx' to the image using ORAS, and finally discovers the attached SBOM displaying it in a tree format. Requires cdxgen, ORAS CLI, and access to the container image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON3.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen --generate-key-and-sign -t docker -o bom.json docker.io/<repo>/sign-test:latest
oras attach --artifact-type sbom/cyclonedx docker.io/<repo>/sign-test:latest ./bom.json:application/json
oras discover -o tree docker.io/<repo>/sign-test:latest
```

TITLE: GitHub Action Workflow with cdxgen and permissions
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows a GitHub Action workflow that uses cdxgen with the Node.js permissions model. It demonstrates setting the `NODE_OPTIONS` environment variable and running cdxgen commands with specified permissions. Understanding GitHub Actions and the build agent's file system is crucial for configuring this correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/PERMISSIONS.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: repotests
  run: |
    bin/cdxgen.js -p -t java ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/repotests/java-sec-code -o ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/bomresults/bom-java-sec-code-1.json --fail-on-error
    bin/cdxgen.js -p -r -t quarkus ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/repotests/quarkus-quickstarts -o ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/bomresults/bom-quarkus-quickstarts-quarkus.json --no-recurse --fail-on-error
    bin/cdxgen.js -p -t js -o ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/bomresults/bom-iot.json ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/repotests/iot-device-simulator --fail-on-error
  shell: bash
  env:
    NODE_OPTIONS: "--permission --allow-fs-read=/home/runner/* --allow-fs-read=/tmp/* --allow-fs-read=/run/user/1001/* --allow-fs-read=/opt/hostedtoolcache/* --allow-fs-write=/tmp/* --allow-fs-read=/Users/runner/* --allow-fs-read=${{ github.workspace }}/* --allow-fs-write=${{ github.workspace }}/bomresults/*.json --allow-fs-read=${{ runner.temp }}/* --allow-fs-write=${{ runner.temp }}/* --allow-child-process --trace-warnings"
    CDXGEN_TEMP_DIR: ${{ runner.temp }}/cdxgen-repotests
```

TITLE: Defining TensorFlow Lite Build Options in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Defines several cache variables using the `option` command, allowing users to configure the TFLite build. Options control enabling/disabling features like install rules (`TFLITE_ENABLE_INSTALL`), experimental RUY integration (`TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY`), resource support (`TFLITE_ENABLE_RESOURCE`), NNAPI (`TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI`), MMAP (`TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP`), GPU delegate (`TFLITE_ENABLE_GPU`), Metal delegate (`TFLITE_ENABLE_METAL`), XNNPACK backend (`TFLITE_ENABLE_XNNPACK`), external delegates (`TFLITE_ENABLE_EXTERNAL_DELEGATE`), and kernel tests (`TFLITE_KERNEL_TEST`). A dependent option for verbose NNAPI validation is also included.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
include(CMakeDependentOption)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_INSTALL "Enable install rule" OFF)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY "Enable experimental RUY integration" OFF)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_RESOURCE "Enable experimental support for resources" ON)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI "Enable NNAPI (Android only)." ON)
cmake_dependent_option(TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI_VERBOSE_VALIDATION "Enable NNAPI verbose validation." OFF
                       "TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI" ON)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP "Enable MMAP (unsupported on Windows)" ON)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_GPU "Enable GPU" OFF)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_METAL "Enable Metal delegate (iOS only)" OFF)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_XNNPACK "Enable XNNPACK backend" ON)
option(TFLITE_ENABLE_EXTERNAL_DElegate "Enable External Delegate backend" ON)

option(TFLITE_KERNEL_TEST "Enable tflite kernel unit test" OFF)
if(TFLITE_KERNEL_TEST AND ${CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING})
  set(TFLITE_HOST_TOOLS_DIR "" CACHE PATH "Host tools directory")
  if(TFLITE_HOST_TOOLS_DIR STREQUAL "")
    message(FATAL_ERROR "Path to the natively compiled 'flatc' compiler binary has not been provided!\
                        Please specify it using -DTFLITE_HOST_TOOLS_DIR=<flatc_dir_path> launch argument.")
  endif()
endif()
```

TITLE: Setting Platform-Specific Compiler Flags for TensorFlow Lite in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Configures compiler flags and definitions based on the compiler and target system. For Clang, it suppresses warnings about deprecated declarations (`-Wno-deprecated-declarations`) used in TensorFlow and TFLite/neon2sse. For Windows, it defines `NOMINMAX` and `NOGDI` to avoid macro conflicts, enables large object support (`/bigobj` for MSVC, `-Wa,-mbig-obj` for GCC), defines `_USE_MATH_DEFINES`, and potentially lowers optimization from `/O2` to `/O1` for MSVC Win32 builds due to compiler limitations. For Android, it adds the standard log library (`log`) to the dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
set(TF_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "")
if(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "Clang$")
  # TensorFlow uses a heap of deprecated proto fields so surpress these
  # warnings until they're fixed.
  list(APPEND TF_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "-Wno-deprecated-declarations")
endif()
# Additional compiler flags used when compiling TF Lite.
set(TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS "-DEIGEN_NEON_GEBP_NR=4")
set(TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "")
set(TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_DEFINITIONS "")
if(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "Clang$")
  # TFLite uses deprecated methods in neon2sse which generates a huge number of
  # warnings so surpress these until they're fixed.
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "-Wno-deprecated-declarations")
endif()
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "Windows")
  # Use NOMINMAX to disable the min / max macros in windows.h as they break
  # use of std::min std::max.
  # Use NOGDI to ERROR macro which breaks TensorFlow logging.
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "-DNOMINMAX" "-DNOGDI")
  # lite/kernels/conv.cc has more than 64k sections so enable /bigobj to
  # support compilation with MSVC2015.
  if(MSVC)
    list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "/bigobj")
    if(CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 4)
      message("Disabling MSVC /O2 optimization for Win32")
      set(CompFlags
        CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE
        CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
        CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
        CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE
        CMAKE_C_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
        CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
      )
      foreach (CompFlag ${CompFlags})
        string(REGEX REPLACE "(\\/Ob. )" "" ${CompFlag} "${${CompFlag}}")
        string(REPLACE "/O2" "/O1" ${CompFlag} "${${CompFlag}}")
        list(REMOVE_DUPLICATES ${CompFlag})
        set(${CompFlag} "${${CompFlag}}" CACHE INTERNAL "")
      endforeach()
    endif()
    list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_DEFINITIONS "_USE_MATH_DEFINES")
  elseif(CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUCXX)
    list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS "-Wa,-mbig-obj")
  endif()
endif()
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "Android")
  find_library(ANDROID_LOG_LIB log)
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES
    log
  )
endif()
```

TITLE: Initializing TensorFlow Lite CMake Project
DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum required CMake version (3.16), defines the project name (`tensorflow-lite`) and languages (C/CXX). It configures CMake policies (CMP0028, CMP0042) for modern target naming and RPATH handling, enables position-independent code (PIC), and sets up variables pointing to TensorFlow and TFLite source directories. It also configures the default build type to 'Release' if not otherwise specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.16)
if(NOT CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE)
  message(STATUS "Setting build type to Release, for debug builds use" 
    "'-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug'.")
  set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE "Release")
endif()

# Double colon in target name means ALIAS or IMPORTED target.
cmake_policy(SET CMP0028 NEW)
# Enable MACOSX_RPATH (@rpath) for built dynamic libraries.
cmake_policy(SET CMP0042 NEW)
project(tensorflow-lite C CXX)
set(CMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE ON)
set(TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR "" CACHE PATH
  "Directory that contains the TensorFlow project"
)
if(NOT TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR)
  get_filename_component(TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR
    "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/../../"
    ABSOLUTE
  )
endif()
set(TF_SOURCE_DIR "${TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR}/tensorflow")
set(TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}")
set(CMAKE_MODULE_PATH
  "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/tools/cmake/modules"
  ${CMAKE_MODULE_PATH}
)
set(CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
  "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/tools/cmake/modules"
  ${CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH}
)
include(GNUInstallDirs)
```

TITLE: Defining TFLite Library Sources
DESCRIPTION: This code block sets the `_ALL_TFLITE_SRCS` variable with a comprehensive list of source files required for building the core TFLite library, including both core components and those related to delegates and experimental features.  It uses existing variables like `TFLITE_CORE_ACCELERATION_SRCS` etc. and expands them. Prerequisites are the source file paths defined elsewhere.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# TFLite library
set(_ALL_TFLITE_SRCS
  ${TFLITE_CORE_ACCELERATION_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_CORE_API_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_CORE_C_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_CORE_EXPERIMENTAL_SRCS}

  ${TFLITE_C_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_FLEX_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_NNAPI_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_XNNPACK_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_EXTERNAL_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_EXPERIMENTAL_REMAT_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_EXPERIMENTAL_RESOURCE_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_EXPERIMENTAL_RUY_PROFILER_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_EXPERIMENTAL_RUY_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_OPT_INTEGER_OPS_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_OPT_SPARSE_OPS_SRCS}
  ${TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_OPT_SRCS}

  ${TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_REF_INTEGER_OPS_SRCS}

TITLE: Filtering TensorFlow Lite source files using CMake in CMakeLists.txt
DESCRIPTION: This CMake snippet filters out TensorFlow Lite source files from the build source list using regex pattern matching. It excludes files related to the XNNPACK delegate to prefer a weak-symbol alternative, Flex-related source files, TensorFlow profiler logger files, and conditionally excludes mmap allocation sources depending on the _TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP flag. The snippet requires CMake as the build system and operates on the variable TFLITE_SRCS, which holds the list of source files. It inputs regex patterns to exclude matching files, ensuring the final source list is tailored to the desired build configuration and dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# XNNPACK delegate is preferred to the weak-symbol one.
list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*tflite_with_xnnpack\\.cc$")

# Exclude Flex related files.
list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*with_selected_ops\\.cc$")

# Exclude tensorflow_profiler_logger files.
list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*tensorflow_profiler_logger\\.cc$")

if(_TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP)
  list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*mmap_allocation_disabled\\.cc$")
else()
  list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*mmap_allocation\\.cc$")
endif()
```

TITLE: Building and Pushing Container Image using Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: Builds a Docker container image named 'sign-test' tagged as latest under a specified repository and pushes it to a container registry. Requires Docker or Podman installed and configured, and access to the target registry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON3.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker build -t docker.io/<repo>/sign-test:latest -f Dockerfile .
docker push docker.io/<repo>/sign-test:latest
```

TITLE: Cloning and compiling Dependency Track (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet clones the Dependency Track repository from GitHub, navigates to the directory, and compiles the project using Maven.  The Maven command includes several profiles (-P flags) to exclude war files, enhance the project, and use an embedded Jetty server. It also skips tests. This process sets up Dependency Track for integration or testing purposes and is a prerequisite for the later cdxgen command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON4.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/DependencyTrack/dependency-track
cd dependency-track
mvn clean compile -P clean-exclude-wars -P enhance -P embedded-jetty -DskipTests
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Package Hashes in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines hashes (SHA256) to verify the integrity of `cycler` package. This hash is part of a security measure in package management. Before installing, the installer (e.g. pip) checks that the downloaded package matches the provided hash. It takes Python version into account, and is valid for Python 3.8.1 up to Python 3.11.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
cycler==0.12.0 ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.12" \
    --hash=sha256:7896994252d006771357777d0251f3e34d266f4fa5f2c572247a80ab01440947
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating CBOM for Python Projects Using cbom Alias - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell command uses the 'cbom' alias to generate a Cryptography Bill of Materials (CBOM) for Python projects. Like the Java version, it sets the necessary options to include cryptographic dependencies and evidence, uses the latest spec version, and outputs to a file if specified. The commented-out cdxgen variant shows an equivalent manual invocation. Prerequisites: cbom alias or cdxgen CLI, Python project structure. Input: project path (implicit); Output: CBOM file ('bom.json'). Limitations: Only supports Python projects.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cbom -t python
# cdxgen -t python --include-crypto -o bom.json --spec-version .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling License Resolution via Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set the `FETCH_LICENSE` environment variable to `true`. This enables cdxgen to query public registries to automatically resolve package licenses, which is time-consuming and disabled by default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export FETCH_LICENSE=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Java 17 Slim Docker Image (shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using the ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17-slim:v11 image, designed for Java 17 applications without additional build tools like gcc. It mounts volumes for caching dependencies (.m2), the project directory (/app), and a temporary directory (/tmp) to generate an SBOM (bom.json) for the specified project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17-slim:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

TITLE: Default Locations for evinse SQLite Cache Database
DESCRIPTION: Shows the default file paths for the `.atomdb` SQLite database used by evinse for caching on Linux, Windows, and macOS. This location can be overridden by setting the `ATOM_DB` environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// linux
let ATOM_DB = join(homedir(), ".local", "share", ".atomdb");

// Windows
ATOM_DB = join(homedir(), "AppData", "Local", ".atomdb");

// Mac
ATOM_DB = join(homedir(), "Library", "Application Support", ".atomdb");
```

It executes the Turbine tool via Java, configuring module access and specifying inputs (sources, bootclasspath, classpath) and outputs (output JAR, output deps file) along with javac options.

TITLE: Configuring NNAPI Delegate Sources Conditionally in CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the NNAPI delegate source files based on whether NNAPI support is enabled. When enabled, it finds the required fp16 headers, populates NNAPI delegate source variables filtering out disabled or test files, and conditionally adds a public compile flag for verbose validation. If disabled, it sets source files that represent disabled implementations for fallback purposes. It handles dependencies and source inclusion for Android Neural Networks API integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(_TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI)
  find_package(fp16_headers REQUIRED)
  populate_tflite_source_vars("delegates/nnapi"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_NNAPI_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test_list|_disabled)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "nnapi" TFLITE_NNAPI_SRCS FILTER "(_disabled)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  list(APPEND TFLITE_NNAPI_SRCS
    "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/nnapi/sl/SupportLibrary.cc"
  )
  if(${TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI_VERBOSE_VALIDATION})
    list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS "-DNNAPI_VERBOSE_VALIDATION")
  endif()
else()
  set(TFLITE_DELEGATES_NNAPI_SRCS
    "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/nnapi/nnapi_delegate_disabled.cc"
  )
  set(TFLITE_NNAPI_SRCS
    "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/nnapi/nnapi_implementation_disabled.cc"
  )
endif()
```

TITLE: Including Documentation Targets and Additional Subdirectories with CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet finds and requires Sphinx for documentation generation when either man pages or HTML docs are enabled. It creates a custom 'doc' target that depends on bson and mongoc documentation targets. The snippet also adds the main source directory for build and handles subdirectory inclusion carefully to avoid duplicate inclusions of modules. These steps ensure documentation and source modules are properly prepared in the build process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (ENABLE_MAN_PAGES STREQUAL ON OR ENABLE_HTML_DOCS STREQUAL ON)
   find_package (Sphinx REQUIRED)
   add_custom_target (doc
      ALL
      DEPENDS
         $<$<NOT:$<BOOL:${USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON}>>:bson-doc>
         $<$<BOOL:${ENABLE_MONGOC}>:mongoc-doc>
   )
endif ()

# sub-directory 'doc' was already included above
add_subdirectory (src)
# 'src/libbson' was already included, so 'src' will not include it directly
# 'src/kms-message' was already included if appropriate
# 'src/libmongoc' was already included, so 'src' will not include it directly
```

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Python 3.9 Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for Python 3.9 applications, which supports full dependency tree construction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python39:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
```

TITLE: Citing the CycloneDX/cdxgen Datasets (BibTeX)
DESCRIPTION: This BibTeX entry provides the standard citation format for the CycloneDX and cdxgen datasets hosted on Hugging Face. It includes the authors, title, publication source (URL), month, and year.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/fine-tuning/README.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bibtex
CODE:
```
@misc{cdx-docs-data,
  author = {OWASP CycloneDX Generator Team},
  month = Feb,
  title = {{CycloneDX and cdxgen}},
  howpublished = {{https://huggingface.co/datasets/CycloneDX/cdx-docs-data}},
  year = {2025}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring System libbson Support
DESCRIPTION: This code searches for the system-installed libbson library, validates its presence and version, disables tests if found, and ensures required targets are available for shared and static libraries, allowing for external libbson integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON)
   message (STATUS "Searching for libbson CMake packages")
   find_package (bson-1.0
      "${MONGOC_MAJOR_VERSION}.${MONGOC_MINOR_VERSION}.${MONGOC_MICRO_VERSION}"
      HINTS
      ${BSON_ROOT_DIR})

   if (NOT bson-1.0_FOUND)
      message (FATAL_ERROR "System libbson not found")
   endif ()

   message (STATUS "libbson found version \"${bson-1.0_VERSION}\"")
   message (STATUS "disabling test-libmongoc since using system libbson")
   SET (ENABLE_TESTS OFF)

   set (USING_SYSTEM_BSON TRUE)
   if (NOT TARGET mongo::bson_shared)
           message (FATAL_ERROR "System libbson built without shared library target")
   endif ()
   set (BSON_LIBRARIES mongo::bson_shared)
   if (NOT TARGET mongo::bson_static)
           message (FATAL_ERROR "System libbson built without static library target")
   endif ()
   set (BSON_STATIC_LIBRARIES mongo::bson_static)
endif ()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen for .NET Projects in Docker (Default SDK)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container to generate an SBOM for a .NET project. Mounts the current directory as `/app` inside the container. Uses the default `ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen` image which includes .NET SDK 8.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -it ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen -r /app -o bom.json -t dotnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exporting BOM as Protobuf Binary with cdxgen - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell command argument instructs cdxgen to serialize and export the generated Bill of Materials (BOM) as a protobuf binary. '--export-proto' enables protobuf export mode and '--proto-bin-file' specifies the output file. Only CycloneDX specification version 1.5 is supported in this mode. Prerequisites: cdxgen installed; use with compatible cdxgen version. Input: None; Output: 'bom.cdx.bin' file. Limitations: Does not support spec versions other than 1.5.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
--export-proto --proto-bin-file bom.cdx.bin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Printing SBOM as Table
DESCRIPTION: This shell command generates an SBOM for a Java project and prints it as a table in the console. The `-p` option is used to enable the table printing functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t java -o bom.json -p
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate tabular output for SBOM
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a tabular representation of the SBOM. The `-p` argument instructs cdxgen to print the SBOM as a table to the console, in addition to writing it to bom.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t java -o bom.json -p
```

TITLE: Generate Meson wrapdb releases data (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This sequence of shell commands clones the Meson wrapdb Git repository, changes the current directory to the cloned repository, and then executes a Python script from the cdxgen project to generate wrapdb release data. This requires Git and Python to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/mesonbuild/wrapdb --depth=1
cd wrapdb
python <path to cdxgen>/contrib/wrapdb.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including CCache and Linker Setup
DESCRIPTION: This snippet includes support for CCache to speed up recompilation and conditionally includes the LLD linker unless compiling with MSVC, enhancing build efficiency and linker performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
include (CCache)

# Link with LLD, if possible
if (NOT MSVC)
   include (LLDLinker)
endif ()
```

import { createBom, submitBom } from "npm:@cyclonedx/cdxgen@^9.0.1";

It executes JavaBuilder via Java, configuring module access, specifying output paths for the main JAR, native header, and manifest proto, bootclasspath, sources (implicitly via input deps), and various javac options for compilation.

TITLE: Configuring GPU Delegate Sources and Dependencies Conditionally in CMake
DESCRIPTION: When GPU delegate support is enabled, this snippet configures package dependencies for OpenCL, Vulkan, fp16, and platform-specific headers like OpenGL and EGL. It populates GPU-related source variables with filtering to exclude test and specific implementation files, appends all GPU delegate source files together, and includes necessary directories. It also sets compilation options, effectively preparing the build environment for GPU acceleration support while excluding tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(TFLITE_ENABLE_GPU)
  find_package(opencl_headers REQUIRED)
  find_package(vulkan_headers REQUIRED)
  find_package(fp16_headers REQUIRED)
  if(NOT "${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "Android")
    find_package(opengl_headers REQUIRED)
    find_package(egl_headers REQUIRED)
  endif()
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/cl" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test|gl_interop|gpu_api_delegate|egl_sync)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/cl/default" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_DEFAULT_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/cl/kernels" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_KERNELS_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/default" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_DEFAULT_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/memory_management"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_MEMORY_MANAGEMENT_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/selectors" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SELECTORS_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/selectors/default" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SELECTORS_DEFAULT_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common" TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/task"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASK_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/tasks"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASKS_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/tasks/special"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASKS_SPECIAL_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  populate_tflite_source_vars(
    "delegates/gpu/common/transformations"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TRANSFORMATIONS_SRCS
    FILTER "(_test)\\.(cc|h)$"
  )
  list(APPEND TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_SRCS
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/api.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/delegate.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/delegate_options.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/tflite_profile.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/experimental/acceleration/compatibility/android_info.cc
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_DEFAULT_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_CL_KERNELS_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_DEFAULT_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_MEMORY_MANAGEMENT_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SELECTORS_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SELECTORS_DEFAULT_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASK_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASKS_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TASKS_SPECIAL_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_GPU_COMMON_TRANSFORMATIONS_SRCS}
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/tools/versioning/gpu_compatibility.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/tools/versioning/op_signature.cc
  )
  include_directories(
    AFTER
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/common
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/common/task
  )
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS "-DCL_DELEGATE_NO_GL" "-DEGL_NO_X11")
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES
    absl::any
    absl::flat_hash_map
  )
endif()
```

TITLE: Configuring Conan Dependencies for cdxgen Project
DESCRIPTION: This Conan configuration defines required dependencies, build requirements, and generators for the cdxgen project. It specifies libcurl as a runtime dependency, fmt as a build dependency, and uses the CMake generator for project configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/conanfile.with_custom_pkg_user_channel.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: conan
CODE:
```
[requires]
libcurl/8.1.2@internal/stable

[build_requires]
fmt/10.0.0@internal/stable

[generators]
cmake
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Ruby 3.4.1 (Debian) Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for Ruby 3.4.1 applications using the Debian-based cdxgen-debian-ruby34 image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby34:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen for .NET Projects in Docker (Custom SDK)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using a custom image that includes a specific .NET SDK version (e.g., .NET Core 3.1 or 6.0) required by the project. Mounts the current directory as `/app`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -it ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet:v11 -r /app -o bom.json -t dotnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating a CBOM (Cryptography BOM) for Java
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to generate a Cryptography Bill of Materials for a Java project using the `cbom` alias or the equivalent `cdxgen -t java --include-crypto` command. This feature is currently specific to Java projects.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cbom -t java
cdxgen -t java --include-crypto -o bom.json .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Public Git Repository via GET Request (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use `curl` to send a GET request to a running `cdxgen` server (`http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom`) to generate an SBOM for a public GitHub repository. Key parameters include `url` (repository URL), `multiProject` (boolean flag), and `type` (project type, e.g., 'js').
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: cdxi Interactive REPL
DESCRIPTION: Starts the `cdxi` interactive REPL server, which allows users to create, import, and search SBOMs using custom commands and standard Node.js functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxi
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Java Source Jar with singlejar (Second Action) (Build Command)
DESCRIPTION: Describes a second Bazel action using the 'JavaSourceJar' mnemonic to package source files into a JAR archive using the `singlejar_local` tool. Similar to the first source JAR action, specifying output path and compression options, typically used for the main application sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/bazel/bazel-state.txt#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: Command Line
CODE:
```
external/remote_java_tools_linux/java_tools/src/tools/singlejar/singlejar_local
--output
bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/java-maven-src.jar
--compression
--normalize
--exclude_build_data
--warn_duplicate_resources
```

TITLE: Declaring Package Hashes for exceptiongroup in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet declares a hash for the `exceptiongroup` Python package. The hash is a SHA256 checksum to verify the integrity of the downloaded package during installation.  The package also includes version constraints. This is relevant for Python versions 3.8.1 up to but not including 3.11
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
exceptiongroup==1.1.3 ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.11" \
    --hash=sha256:097acd85d473d75af5bb98e41b61ff7fe35efe6675e4f9370ec6ec5126d160e9 \
    --hash=sha256:343280667a4585d195ca1cf9cef84a4e178c4b6cf2274caef9859782b567d5e3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Pre-PR Checks for cdxgen Contribution (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to prepare a contribution for the cdxgen project. Enables pnpm via corepack, installs dependencies ensuring strict dependency builds, generates types using JSDoc, runs the biomejs formatter/linter with auto-fix, and executes jest tests. These steps are required before submitting a pull request to ensure code quality and consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
corepack enable pnpm
pnpm install --config.strict-dep-builds=true
# Generate types using jsdoc syntax
pnpm run gen-types
# Run biomejs formatter and linter with auto fix
pnpm run lint
# Run jest tests
pnpm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Package Hashes for h11 in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides SHA256 hashes for the `h11` Python package. These hashes are used for verifying the integrity of the package during installation, which helps ensure that the installed package is the intended version. This declaration applies to Python versions between 3.8.1 and 3.11.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
h11==0.14.0 ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.12" \
    --hash=sha256:8f19fbbe99e72420ff35c00b27a34cb9937e902a8b810e2c88300c6f0a3b699d \
    --hash=sha256:e3fe4ac4b851c468cc8363d500db52c2ead036020723024a109d37346efaa761
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Kernel Tests, Benchmark Tool, and Examples
DESCRIPTION: This code adds subdirectories for kernel tests, the benchmark tool, and the label_image example, based on defined flags. It also defines a wrapper library, `_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper`, for the python interpreter. Dependencies are `TFLITE_KERNEL_TEST`,  `TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR` and the `tensorflow-lite` target defined earlier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# The kernel tests.
if(TFLITE_KERNEL_TEST)
  enable_testing()
  add_subdirectory(${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/kernels)
endif()

# The benchmark tool.
add_subdirectory(${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/tools/benchmark)

# The label_image example.
add_subdirectory(${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/examples/label_image)

# Python interpreter wrapper.
add_library(_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper SHARED EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/python/interpreter_wrapper/interpreter_wrapper.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/python/interpreter_wrapper/interpreter_wrapper_pybind11.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/python/interpreter_wrapper/numpy.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/python/interpreter_wrapper/python_error_reporter.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/python/interpreter_wrapper/python_utils.cc
)

# To remove "lib" prefix.
set_target_properties(_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper PROPERTIES PREFIX "")

target_include_directories(_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper
  PUBLIC
    ${TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR}
)

target_link_libraries(_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper
  tensorflow-lite
  ${CMAKE_DL_LIBS}
)
target_compile_options(_pywrap_tensorflow_interpreter_wrapper
  PUBLIC ${TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS}
  PRIVATE ${TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS}
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing cdxgen Main Branch Globally (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to install and test the latest development version (main branch) of cdxgen globally using pnpm. It involves enabling and setting up pnpm via corepack, finding the pnpm bin directory, globally adding cdxgen directly from its GitHub repository (specifying the sqlite3 build dependency), and finally verifying the installation by running the help command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
corepack pnpm bin -g
corepack pnpm setup
corepack pnpm add -g --allow-build sqlite3 https://github.com/CycloneDX/cdxgen
cdxgen --help
```

TITLE: Generating JSONL from JSDoc using Gemini Prompt (Text)
DESCRIPTION: This prompt guides Google Gemini to convert JSDoc comments from JavaScript files into the JSON Lines chat format. It targets questions a junior engineer might ask about functions, using only the JSDoc content for answers. The prompt requires generating at least 200 question-answer pairs, escaping double quotes, and producing plain text JSON lines without extra formatting or guessing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/fine-tuning/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
you are an expert in converting jsdoc comments to a single plain text jsonlines format based on the my template. {"messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "<user_question>"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "<detailed_explanation>"}]}. Understand the contents of the jsdoc comments like a javascript developer. Generate at least 200 possible questions a junior engineer might ask about a given function and a long explanation to answer the question based entirely on the jsdoc comment. Substitute "user_question" with your generated question and "detailed_explanation" with your generated explanation. Escape double quotes with a backslash \ to make each line a valid json. Generate a plain text response of json line by line without any commas or list. I will start uploading the js files with cmments in the rest of the chat session. generate a single plain text response without any markdown formatting for the entire response. Do not show your thinking. Do not include any answers guessed.
```

It displays details about the created `cdx1` model, including its architecture (llama), parameter count (14.7B), context length, embedding length, quantization level (Q8_0), configured parameters (num_ctx, stop sequences, temperature), and the system prompt.

```
ollama show cdx1
