TITLE: Installing cdxgen via npm - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs the cdxgen tool globally using npm, allowing for subsequent SBOM generation commands. Requires Node.js version greater than 20 and network access to npm. Installs the @cyclonedx/cdxgen package globally and prepares the environment for generating SBOM files. Outputs installation logs to the terminal and makes cdxgen commands available system-wide.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON2.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Advanced SBOM with cdxgen and Node.js environment variables
DESCRIPTION: This command sets an environment variable to include specific npm installation arguments and runs cdxgen against the Juice Shop directory to produce a comprehensive SBOM in JSON format, ensuring dependency lock files are utilized for accuracy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd juice-shop
export NPM_INSTALL_ARGS="--package-lock --legacy-peer-deps"
cndxgen -o bom.json -t js .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scan git repo with cURL using POST and JSON data
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to scan a git repository by sending a POST request to the cdxgen server with JSON data. It specifies the git repository URL, project type, and enables multi-project mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:9090/sbom -XPOST -d $'{"url": "https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git", "type": "nodejs", "multiProject": "true"}'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating SBOM with cdxgen for ASVS 4.0.3 (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This shell command uses cdxgen to create an SBOM in JSON format ('bom.json') for a Java project, specifically targeting the ASVS 4.0.3 standard. The `-t java` specifies the project type, and `--standard asvs-4.0.3` tells cdxgen to include the ASVS requirements. This command requires that cdxgen is installed and that the current directory is 'dependency-track'. The output is written to the file 'bom.json'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON4.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd dependency-track
cdxgen -o bom.json -t java --standard asvs-4.0.3
```

TITLE: Adding TFLite Library and Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This snippet adds the `tensorflow-lite` library and sets up its properties and dependencies.  It uses the `_ALL_TFLITE_SRCS` variable (defined previously) as the source files. It defines public and private link dependencies. Also, it sets compiler options. Build type, shared or static library, is controlled via `BUILD_SHARED_LIBS` variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
add_library(tensorflow-lite
  ${_ALL_TFLITE_SRCS}
)
set(_ALL_TFLITE_HDRS ${_ALL_TFLITE_SRCS})
list(FILTER _ALL_TFLITE_HDRS INCLUDE REGEX ".*\\.h$")
target_include_directories(tensorflow-lite
  PUBLIC $<BUILD_INTERFACE:${TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR}> $<INSTALL_INTERFACE:${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}>
)
target_link_libraries(tensorflow-lite
  PUBLIC
    Eigen3::Eigen
    absl::flags
    absl::hash
    absl::status
    absl::strings
    absl::synchronization
    absl::variant
    farmhash
    fft2d_fftsg2d
    flatbuffers::flatbuffers
    gemmlowp::gemmlowp
    ml_dtypes
    ruy::ruy
    pthreadpool
    ${CMAKE_DL_LIBS}
    ${TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES}
)

if (NOT BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS "-DTFL_STATIC_LIBRARY_BUILD")
endif()

target_compile_options(tensorflow-lite
  PUBLIC ${TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS}
  PRIVATE ${TFLITE_TARGET_PRIVATE_OPTIONS}
)
add_library(${PROJECT_NAME}::tensorflowlite ALIAS tensorflow-lite)
```

DESCRIPTION: Uses the `populate_tflite_source_vars` macro (defined earlier) to collect all non-test source and header files (`.c`, `.cc`, `.h`) from the main TFLite source directory (`${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/.`) into the `TFLITE_SRCS` CMake list variable. It includes a conditional filter to exclude `simple_memory_arena_debug_dump.cc` specifically when building shared libraries (`BUILD_SHARED_LIBS` is ON) on Windows, likely due to build issues or dependencies specific to that configuration.

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Build a list of source files to compile into the TF Lite library.
populate_tflite_source_vars("." TFLITE_SRCS)
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "Windows" AND BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)
  list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*simple_memory_arena_debug_dump\\.cc$")
endif()
```

TITLE: Generating JSONL from Markdown using Gemini Prompt (Text)
DESCRIPTION: This prompt instructs Google Gemini to act as an expert in converting Markdown files into a plain text JSON Lines format. It specifies a template (`{"messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "<user_question>"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "<detailed_explanation>"}]}`) and asks Gemini to generate 500 potential user questions and detailed answers based on the Markdown content, formatting each pair as a valid JSON line. It requires escaping double quotes and newlines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/fine-tuning/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
you are an expert in converting markdown files to plain text jsonlines format based on the my template. {"messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "<user_question>"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "<detailed_explanation>"}]}. Understand the contents of the markdown file. Generate 500 possible questions a user might and a detailed explanation to answer the question. Substitute "user_question" with your generated question and "detailed_explanation" with your generated explanation. Escape double quotes and new lines with a backslash \ to make each line a valid json. Generate a plain text response of json line by line without any commas or list. I will start uploading the markdown files in the rest of the chat session.
```

TITLE: Defining CMake Macros for Populating Source File Lists
DESCRIPTION: Defines three CMake macros (`populate_source_vars`, `populate_tflite_source_vars`, `populate_tf_source_vars`) to simplify the process of collecting source (.c, .cc, .h) and header files. The base macro `populate_source_vars` uses `file(GLOB...)` to find files, filters out test files (`*_test.*`, `*test_util.*`) by default, and allows for custom filters and recursion. The other two macros are convenience wrappers that call `populate_source_vars` with paths relative to the TFLite and TensorFlow source directories respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Simplifies inclusion of non-test sources and headers from a directory.
# SOURCE_DIR: Directory to search for files.
# SOURCES_VAR: Variable to append with all matching *.cc and *.h files.
# [FILTER expression0 .. expressionN]:
#   Additional regular expressions to filter the set of matching
#   files. By default, all files ending in "(_test|test_util)\\.(cc|h)" are
#   removed.
# [RECURSE]: Whether to recursively search SOURCE_DIR.
macro(populate_source_vars SOURCE_DIR SOURCES_VAR)
  cmake_parse_arguments(ARGS "RECURSE" "" "FILTER" ${ARGN})
  if(ARGS_RECURSE)
    set(GLOB_OP GLOB_RECURSE)
  else()
    set(GLOB_OP GLOB)
  endif()
  set(DEFAULT_FILE_FILTER ".*(_test|test_util)\\.(c|cc|h)$")
  file(${GLOB_OP} FOUND_SOURCES "${SOURCE_DIR}/*.*")
  list(FILTER FOUND_SOURCES INCLUDE REGEX ".*\\.(c|cc|h)$")
  list(FILTER FOUND_SOURCES EXCLUDE REGEX "${DEFAULT_FILE_FILTER}")
  foreach(FILE_FILTER ${ARGS_FILTER})
    list(FILTER FOUND_SOURCES EXCLUDE REGEX "${FILE_FILTER}")
  endforeach()
  list(APPEND ${SOURCES_VAR} ${FOUND_SOURCES})
endmacro()
# Simplifies inclusion of non-test sources and headers from a directory
# relative to TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR. See populate_source_vars() for the
# description of arguments including and following SOURCES_VAR.
macro(populate_tflite_source_vars RELATIVE_DIR SOURCES_VAR)
  populate_source_vars(
    "${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/${RELATIVE_DIR}" ${SOURCES_VAR} ${ARGN}
  )
endmacro()
# Simplifies inclusion of non-test sources and headers from a directory
# relative to TF_SOURCE_DIR. See populate_source_vars() for the description of
# arguments including and following SOURCES_VAR.
macro(populate_tf_source_vars RELATIVE_DIR SOURCES_VAR)
  populate_source_vars(
    "${TF_SOURCE_DIR}/${RELATIVE_DIR}" ${SOURCES_VAR} ${ARGN}
  )
endmacro()
```

TITLE: Installing cdxgen via Deno - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs cdxgen using deno's install command, providing file and network permissions as required for SBOM generation. The command specifies the permissions needed for cdxgen operation in Deno environments and sets an alias name 'cdxgen'. Assumes that Deno is installed and the environment meets permission requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/CLI.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
deno install --allow-read --allow-env --allow-run --allow-sys=uid,systemMemoryInfo,gid,homedir --allow-write --allow-net -n cdxgen "npm:@cyclonedx/cdxgen/cdxgen"
```

TITLE: Scanning Private Git Repositories with Authentication (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to authenticate `curl` GET requests to the `cdxgen` server for private repositories using either an access token (GitHub example) or username/password credentials (Bitbucket example) embedded in the `url` parameter. Other parameters like `multiProject` and `type` remain the same.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<access_token>@github.com/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<username>:<password>@bitbucket.org/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

TITLE: Handling TensorFlow Lite Logging Source Selection in CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet determines the TensorFlow Lite logging source file to include based on the target platform, filtering source files to exclude minimal logging implementation, and appending platform-specific minimal logging sources for Android, iOS, or default. It ensures that appropriate platform-tailored logging is used during the build process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
list(FILTER TFLITE_SRCS EXCLUDE REGEX ".*minimal_logging_.*\\.cc$")
if("${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "Android")
  list(APPEND TFLITE_SRCS ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/minimal_logging_android.cc)
elseif("${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "iOS")
  list(APPEND TFLITE_SRCS ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/minimal_logging_ios.cc)
else()
  list(APPEND TFLITE_SRCS ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/minimal_logging_default.cc)
endif()
```

TITLE: Handling Build Dependencies Flag
DESCRIPTION: This snippet toggles the build dependencies flag to 'ON' under specific conditions, ensuring dependencies are built when source directories differ from the main source.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: CMake

lms ls
lms server status

LANGUAGE: xml

  </Reference>
</ItemDefinitionGroup>
</Project>

TITLE: Conditionally Setting TensorFlow Lite Feature Flags in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Sets internal CMake variables (`_TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY`, `_TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI`, `_TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP`) based on the user-defined options and the target system (`CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME`). RUY is forcibly enabled on Android. NNAPI is forcibly disabled on non-Android systems. MMAP is disabled on Windows. These internal flags likely control conditional compilation and linking later in the script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)
set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY "${TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY}")
if("${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "Android")
  set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_RUY ON)
endif()
set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI "${TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI}")
if(NOT "${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "Android")
  set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_NNAPI OFF)
endif()
set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP "${TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP}")
if(${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME} MATCHES "Windows")
  # See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/\
  # 2b96f3662bd776e277f86997659e61046b56c315/tensorflow/lite/tools/make/\
  # Makefile#L157
  set(_TFLITE_ENABLE_MMAP OFF)
endif()
```

TITLE: Configuring MongoDB C Driver with SSL and AWS Auth Support in CMake
DESCRIPTION: This complex snippet manages build options for enabling the MongoDB C Driver (`ENABLE_MONGOC`) and validates related feature flags such as SSL provider settings (`ENABLE_SSL`) and AWS authentication toggles (`ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH`). It also lists sources for dependencies like utf8proc, zlib, and kms-message. The code enforces constraints on compatibility (e.g., minimum MSVC version for AWS auth), sets variables controlling conditional compilation, and includes subdirectories to pull in core client and message components, enabling a feature-rich and flexible build setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (ENABLE_MONGOC)
   if (ENABLE_TESTS AND NOT MONGOC_ENABLE_STATIC_BUILD)
      message (FATAL_ERROR "ENABLE_TESTS requires ENABLE_STATIC or ENABLE_STATIC_BUILD")
   endif ()

   if (NOT ENABLE_SSL MATCHES "DARWIN|WINDOWS|OPENSSL|LIBRESSL|AUTO|OFF")
      message (FATAL_ERROR
               "ENABLE_SSL option must be DARWIN, WINDOWS, OPENSSL, LIBRESSL, AUTO, or OFF")
   endif ()

   set (SOURCE_DIR "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/")

   set (UTF8PROC_SOURCES
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/utf8proc-2.8.0/utf8proc.c
   )

   set (ZLIB_SOURCES
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/adler32.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/crc32.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/deflate.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/infback.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/inffast.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/inflate.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/inftrees.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/trees.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/zutil.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/compress.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/uncompr.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/gzclose.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/gzlib.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/gzread.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/zlib-1.2.13/gzwrite.c
   )

   set (CPACK_RESOURCE_FILE_LICENSE "${SOURCE_DIR}/COPYING")

   include (CPack)

   # Ensure the default behavior: don't ignore RPATH settings.
   set (CMAKE_SKIP_BUILD_RPATH OFF)

   if (APPLE)
      # Until CDRIVER-520.
      add_definitions (-Wno-deprecated-declarations)
   endif ()

   set (KMS_MSG_SOURCES
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/hexlify.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_b64.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_caller_identity_request.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_crypto_apple.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_crypto_libcrypto.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_crypto_none.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_crypto_windows.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_decrypt_request.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_encrypt_request.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_kmip_response_parser.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_kv_list.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_message.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_port.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_request.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_request_opt.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_request_str.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_response.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/kms_response_parser.c
      ${SOURCE_DIR}/src/kms-message/src/sort.c
   )

   if (NOT ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH MATCHES "ON|OFF|AUTO")
      message (FATAL_ERROR "ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH option must be ON, AUTO, or OFF")
   endif ()
   set (MONGOC_ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH 0)
   if (ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH STREQUAL ON)
      if (MSVC AND MSVC_VERSION LESS 1900)
         message (FATAL_ERROR "Use Visual Studio 2015 or higher for ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH")
      endif ()
      if (ENABLE_SSL STREQUAL OFF)
         message (FATAL_ERROR
            "Option ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH requires ENABLE_SSL not set to OFF"
         )
      endif ()
      set (MONGOC_ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH 1)
   elseif (ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH STREQUAL AUTO)
      if (MSVC AND MSVC_VERSION LESS 1900)
         message (WARNING "MS Visual Studio too old for ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH")
      elseif (ENABLE_SSL STREQUAL OFF)
              message (WARNING
            "Option ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH requires ENABLE_SSL not set to OFF"
         )
      else ()
         set (MONGOC_ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH 1)
      endif ()
   endif ()

   add_subdirectory (src/libmongoc)

   if (MONGOC_ENABLE_MONGODB_AWS_AUTH)
      message (STATUS "Building with MONGODB-AWS auth support")
   endif ()
```

TITLE: Example cdxgen REPL Workflow (Shell/JSONata)
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a typical workflow within the `cdxgen` REPL. It shows creating an SBOM from a path (`.create`), displaying its contents (`.print`), searching for components (`.search`), executing complex JSONata queries (`.query`) for filtering and data extraction, sorting components based on attributes (`.sort`), and modifying component data using a query and update syntax (`.update`). Specific query examples target component names, scopes, suppliers, OS metadata, file paths, and process indicators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
.create /mnt/work/vuln-spring
.print
.search spring
.query components[name ~> /spring/ and scope = "required"]
// Supplier names
.query $distinct(components.supplier.name)

# Check obom metadata for windows os
.query metadata.component[purl ~> /Windows/]

# check if docker is installed in the c drive
.query components[name ~> /Docker/ and properties.value ~> "C:"]

# check if docker is running, exposing a pipe
.query components[name ~> /docker/ and properties[value = "pipes_snapshot"]]

.sort name
.sort components^(>name)
.update | components[name ~> /spring/] | {'publisher': "foo"} |
```

TITLE: Running cdxgen in Nydus Container Using nerdctl - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to launch the cdxgen container image with Nydus snapshotter using nerdctl. It mounts the local Maven repository and the current working directory into the container, and instructs cdxgen to generate a Java BOM targeting the mounted application directory. Prerequisites: nerdctl installed with Nydus snapshotter configured; cdxgen container in 'master-nydus' tag must be available. Parameters used include volume mounts for persistent data and the '-p -t java /app' flags for BOM generation. Input is the target path (/app) and output will be a BOM in the working directory. Limitations: Requires Nydus-enabled container runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo nerdctl --snapshotter nydus run --rm -v $HOME/.m2:/root/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:master-nydus -p -t java /app
```

TITLE: Configuring Project Versioning and Including Modules in CMake - CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the minimum CMake version, modifies the module path, and includes custom modules (BuildVersion, ParseVersion, LoadVersion) to manage project versioning for the mongo-c-driver. It initializes key version variables and writes the current build version to a file, facilitating both human- and script-readable version control in the build process. Dependencies include the custom CMake scripts provided with the project; inputs are project version strings, and outputs are variables used throughout configuration with file-side effects (writing VERSION_CURRENT).
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 3.15)

list (INSERT CMAKE_MODULE_PATH 0 "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/build/cmake")
# Defines BUILD_VERSION, which we use throughout:
include (BuildVersion)

project (
   mongo-c-driver
   LANGUAGES C
   # BUILD_VERSION_SIMPLE is a CMake-compatible version number that omits suffixes
   VERSION "${BUILD_VERSION_SIMPLE}"
)

# Set MONGOC_MAJOR_VERSION, MONGOC_MINOR_VERSION, etc.
include (ParseVersion)
ParseVersion ("${BUILD_VERSION}" MONGOC)
# Defines additional similar variables:
include (LoadVersion)
file (WRITE VERSION_CURRENT "${BUILD_VERSION}")
LoadVersion (VERSION_CURRENT MONGOC)

# Extended version attributes that CMake doesn't (yet) understand, which include
# the prerelease tag. Named here to match the variables generated by project()
set(mongo-c-driver_VERSION_PRERELEASE ${MONGOC_PRERELEASE_VERSION})
set(mongo-c-driver_VERSION_FULL ${MONGOC_VERSION})
```

TITLE: Middleman Action for 2to3.sh
DESCRIPTION: This action is a middleman that combines the input dependencies into an output artifact. It uses the `input_dep_set_ids` to determine the inputs. The `target_id` references 2to3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/bazel/bazel-state.txt#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: proto
CODE:
```
actions {
  target_id: 3
  action_key: "709e80c88487a2411e1ee4dfb9f22a861492d20c4765150c0c794abd70f8147c"
  mnemonic: "Middleman"
  configuration_id: 2
  input_dep_set_ids: 18
  output_ids: 50
  primary_output_id: 50
  execution_platform: "@local_config_platform//:host"
}
```

TITLE: Specifying Platform for nerdctl (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the '--platform=linux/arm64' argument used with 'nerdctl run' to specify the target container architecture. This enables running ARM64 containers on x64 hosts when using Rancher Desktop with nerdctl and multi-platform support configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
--platform=linux/arm64
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Integrate cdxgen as Library
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the cdxgen library to create and submit a BOM programmatically. It imports the `createBom` and `submitBom` functions, creates a BOM from a file path with specified options, and then submits the BOM to a Dependency Track server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createBom, submitBom } from "@cyclonedx/cdxgen";
// bomNSData would contain bomJson
const bomNSData = await createBom(filePath, options);
// Submission to dependency track server
const dbody = await submitBom(args, bomNSData.bomJson);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Git Repo via HTTP API (POST)
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to submit scan arguments, such as repository URL, type, and flags, to the cdxgen HTTP API using a POST request with a JSON payload. This is an alternative to using query parameters for larger or more complex requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:9090/sbom -XPOST -d $'{"url": "https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git", "type": "nodejs", "multiProject": "true"}'
```

TITLE: Declaring Package Hashes for hpack in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet specifies SHA256 hashes for the `hpack` package, for use in verifying the downloaded package during installation. The hashes confirm the package's integrity. Version constraints limit applicability of the hashes to Python versions 3.8.1 and above, and less than 3.12.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
hpack==4.0.0 ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.12" \
    --hash=sha256:84a076fad3dc9a9f8063ccb8041ef100867b1878b25ef0ee63847a5d53818a6c
```

TITLE: Defining Actions (JavaToolchainCompileClasses)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the 'JavaToolchainCompileClasses' action which uses javac to compile classes. It specifies the target ID, action key, mnemonic and a number of arguments which configure the compilation process including source and target version, and options like Xlint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/bazel/bazel-state.txt#_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
actions {
  target_id: 7
  action_key: "bfdb310727e8a2b1994db3b4c82abcfa5a8968a4810fab5896bd5157a81e3e7b"
  mnemonic: "JavaToolchainCompileClasses"
  configuration_id: 3
  arguments: "external/remotejdk11_linux/bin/javac"
  arguments: "-source"
  arguments: "8"
  arguments: "-target"
  arguments: "8"
  arguments: "-Xlint:-options"

```

TITLE: Generating CycloneDX BOM Response with mlx_lm (Temperature: 0.6)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet runs the mlx_lm model with a temperature set at 0.6. The other parameters remain the same as the last runs.  The aim is to observe the behavior of the model at this higher temperature and compare against previous results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/xBOMEval/cdx1-NOTES.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```

TITLE: Conditionally Including Bundled libbson Library in CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet includes the bundled libbson library subdirectory for building if the option USING_SYSTEM_BSON is not set. It sets variables for static and shared BSON libraries as well as the include directory paths for use elsewhere in the build. This ensures that the project can either use system-installed libbson or the bundled copy depending on the user's configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (NOT USING_SYSTEM_BSON)
   message (STATUS "Using bundled libbson")

   add_subdirectory (src/libbson)
   # Defined in src/libbson/CMakeLists.txt
   set (BSON_STATIC_LIBRARIES bson_static)
   set (BSON_LIBRARIES bson_shared)
   set (BSON_STATIC_INCLUDE_DIRS "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/libbson/src" "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/src/libbson/src")
   set (BSON_INCLUDE_DIRS "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/libbson/src" "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/src/libbson/src")
   set (BSON_STATIC_PUBLIC_DEFINITIONS "BSON_STATIC")
endif ()
```

TITLE: Installing cdxgen Binary Plugins
DESCRIPTION: Installs the necessary binary plugins for cdxgen globally using npm. This is required for certain features like generating container SBOMs on Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen-plugins-bin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Java 21 Docker Image (shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using the ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-temurin-java21:v11 image, providing a Java 21 environment. It mounts volumes for caching dependencies (.m2), the project directory (/app), and a temporary directory (/tmp) to generate an SBOM (bom.json) for the specified project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-temurin-java21:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cdxgen via Homebrew - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs cdxgen using the Homebrew package manager, providing a straightforward method for macOS and Linux users. Requires Homebrew to be installed on the system before execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/CLI.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
brew install cdxgen
```

TITLE: Restricting Allowed Git Hosts for cdxgen Server (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Explains how to restrict the `cdxgen` server to only scan repositories from specified hosts (e.g., github.com, gitlab.com) by setting the `CDXGEN_SERVER_ALLOWED_HOSTS` environment variable before starting the server. It then shows a `curl` command to scan an allowed host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/SERVER.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export CDXGEN_SERVER_ALLOWED_HOSTS="github.com,gitlab.com"
cdxgen --server
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

TITLE: Parsing and Validating CSV Columns for CycloneDX Generation in Python
DESCRIPTION: Defines the logic for parsing CSV files where columns are matched case-insensitively to expected fields such as component_purl, component_name, licenses, and hashes. Mandatory fields include component_purl (package URL) and component_name, with validation to report missing or empty mandatory fields clearly. Optional fields such as component_bom_ref, component_group, component_version, licenses, and various hashes are handled with default values or omitted when absent. This process includes converting None or NaN values to empty strings and collecting hash fields into JSON-compliant arrays. It ensures parent component metadata fields are extracted with default values when not present. This snippet presupposes CSV parsing libraries and type-checking for None or NaN values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/cdxgenGPT/cdxgen-for-bots.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
1. Process CSV file, reading column names case-insensitively.
2. Map CSV columns to corresponding values:
   - component_purl: required, if missing or empty, raise error.
   - component_bom_ref: optional, default to component_purl if missing.
   - component_group: optional, default to empty string.
   - component_name: required, if missing or empty, raise error.
   - component_version: optional, default to empty string.
   - licenses: optional, use if column exists (case-insensitive), else omit.
   - hashes: optional, detect hash algorithm columns, assemble JSON array of {alg, content} objects, else omit.
3. For metadata.component fields (parent_component_name, _version, _type), use CSV values or defaults (app, latest, application).
4. Convert None or NaN field values to empty strings before processing.
5. Validate mandatory fields present with non-empty values before proceeding.
```

TITLE: Generating CycloneDX JSON Document via Jinja Template in Jinja
DESCRIPTION: A Jinja template structured to generate a CycloneDX JSON document version 1.6. It dynamically substitutes values such as a UUID-based serialNumber (`random_guid`), timestamp according to ISO 8601 format, and component data parsed from CSV input. The template defines metadata with tool and author information, a parent component with defaults when fields are missing, and components derived from CSV rows. Optional JSON attributes `licenses` and `hashes` are included only if relevant columns are present in the input. The template handles defaulting and omitting empty fields, ensuring output JSON conforms exactly to the CycloneDX spec with proper structure and field names. It requires the invoking environment to supply `random_guid`, `datetime.now()`, and mapped CSV row data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/cdxgenGPT/cdxgen-for-bots.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Jinja
CODE:
```
{
    "bomFormat": "CycloneDX",  
    "specVersion": "1.6",
    "serialNumber": "urn:uuid:{{ random_guid }}",
    "version": 1,
    "metadata": {
        "timestamp": "{{ datetime.now():%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ }}",
        "tools": {
            "services": [
                {
                    "group": "cyclonedx",
                    "name": "cdxgenGPT",
                    "version": "1.0.0",
                    "description: "cdxgenGPT - I\'m a CycloneDX and xBOM expert available on ChatGPT store.",
                    "publisher": "OWASP Foundation",
                    "authors": [
                        {
                            "name": "OWASP Foundation"
                        }
                    ],
                    "authenticated": false,
                    "x-trust-boundary": true,
                    "endpoints": [
                        "https://chatgpt.com/g/g-673bfeb4037481919be8a2cd1bf868d2-cyclonedx-generator-cdxgen"
                    ],
                    "externalReferences": [
                        {"url": "https://chatgpt.com/g/g-673bfeb4037481919be8a2cd1bf868d2-cyclonedx-generator-cdxgen", "type": "chat"}
                    ]
                }
            ]
        },
        "authors": [
            {
                "name": "OWASP Foundation"
            }
        ],
        "component": {
            "name": "{{ parent_component_name | default('app') }}",
            "version": "{{ parent_component_version | default('latest') }}",
            "type": "{{ parent_component_type | default('application') }}",
            "purl": "pkg:{{ parent_component_type }}/{{ parent_component_name }}@{{ parent_component_version }}",
            "bom-ref": "pkg:{{ parent_component_type }}/{{ parent_component_name }}@{{ parent_component_version }}"
        },
    },
    "components": [
        {
            "bom-ref": "{{ bom_ref | component_bom_ref | component_purl }}",
            "type": "{{ type | component_type | default('library') }}",
            "name": "{{ name | component_name }}",
            "version": "{{ version | component_version | default('') }}",
            {% if row['hashes'] %}
            "hashes": [
                {% for alg, content in hashes.items() %}
                {
                    "alg": "{{ alg }}",
                    "content": "{{ content }}"
                }
                {% endfor %}
            ],
            {% endif %}
            {% if row['licenses'] %}
            "licenses": [{"expression": "{{ row['licenses'] }}"}],
            {% endif %}
            "purl": "{{ component_purl }}",
            "group": "{{ component_group | default('') }}"
        }
    ],
    "compositions": [
        {"aggregate": "incomplete"}
    ],
    "annotations": [
        {
            "subjects": {{ serialNumber }},
            "annotator": {
                "service": {
                    "group": "@cyclonedx",
                    "name": "cdxgenGPT",
                    "version": "1.0.0",
                    "description: "cdxgenGPT",
                    "publisher": "OWASP Foundation",
                    "authors": [
                        {
                            "name": "OWASP Foundation"
                        }
                    ],
                    "authenticated": false,
                    "x-trust-boundary": true,
                    "endpoints": [
                        "https://chatgpt.com/g/g-673bfeb4037481919be8a2cd1bf868d2-cyclonedx-generator-cdxgen"
                    ],
                    "externalReferences": [
                        {"url": "https://chatgpt.com/g/g-673bfeb4037481919be8a2cd1bf868d2-cyclonedx-generator-cdxgen", "type": "chat"}
                    ]
                }
            },
            "timestamp": "{{ datetime.now():%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ }}",
            "text": "This CycloneDX xBOM was interactively generated using cdxgenGPT."
        }
    ]
}
```

TITLE: Scan a private git repo with cURL using an access token
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to scan a private git repository using cURL by providing credentials (access token) in the URL. Replace <access_token> with a valid GitHub access token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<access_token>@github.com/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Swift Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for Swift applications using the cdxgen-debian-swift image, mounting the current directory to output a bom.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-swift:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t swift
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Post-Build SBOM for .NET Binaries
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for .NET applications from compiled binaries using cdxgen. Specifies the .NET type (`-t dotnet`) and the `post-build` lifecycle phase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t dotnet --lifecycle post-build -o bom.json <path to dotnet binaries>
```

TITLE: Generating CycloneDX BOM Property Explanation Using MLX Model (Text)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to generate explanations for the 'bomFormat' property in a CycloneDX BOM by querying the mlx_lm.generate tool with different model versions and temperature settings. The purpose is to show how temperature influences the specificity and creativity of the responses, with lower values yielding precise definitions and higher values producing more varied interpretations. Dependencies include access to the CycloneDX models located in specified paths. Input is a prompt related to 'bomFormat', and output is a textual explanation string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/xBOMEval/cdx1-NOTES.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx --prompt "What is the purpose of the bomFormat property in a CycloneDX BOM?" --temp 0.05
==========
The bomFormat property specifies the format of the BOM. It is used to indicate the format of the BOM, such as JSON, XML, or YAML.
==========
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx --prompt "What is the purpose of the bomFormat property in a CycloneDX BOM?" --temp 0.1
==========
The bomFormat property specifies the format of the BOM. It can be used to indicate the version of the CycloneDX specification or other relevant information about the BOM format.
==========
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "What is the purpose of the bomFormat property in a CycloneDX BOM?" --temp 0

The bomFormat property specifies the format of the BOM. It is used to indicate the version of the CycloneDX specification that the BOM conforms to.
==========
```

==========

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Java 11 Slim Docker Image (shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes cdxgen within a Docker container using the ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11-slim:v11 image, designed for Java 11 applications without additional build tools like gcc. It mounts volumes for caching dependencies (.m2), the project directory (/app), and a temporary directory (/tmp) to generate an SBOM (bom.json) for the specified project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11-slim:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using nerdctl with node20 image for SBOM generation
DESCRIPTION: This command is an alternative to Docker, executing the SBOM generation within a containerized environment using nerdctl, with the same Node.js 20 image, facilitating workflows in compatible systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON5.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
nerdctl run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -e "NPM_INSTALL_ARGS=--package-lock --legacy-peer-deps" -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-node20:latest -t js -r /app -o /app/bom.json
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen.git
docker compose up
```

```

TITLE: Generating Short and Detailed CycloneDX SBOM Answers Using MLX Model (Text)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates two modes for generating responses using the mlx_lm.generate tool: a short factual answer and a detailed example for a question about container images to build SBOMs for .NET projects. The short answer is concise and direct, while adding an explicit request for a detailed example along with a system prompt produces a stepwise code example including Docker commands. It also notes that system prompts alone cannot modify default response verbosity. Dependencies include access to the 8-bit CycloneDX MLX model and proper prompt crafting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/xBOMEval/cdx1-NOTES.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "Does cdxgen offer container images for building sbom for dotnet?" --temp 0.05 --system-prompt "You are a helpful assistant to the user."
==========
Yes, cdxgen provides container images for building SBOMs for .NET applications.
==========
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "Does cdxgen offer container images for building sbom for dotnet? Can you provide a detailed example?" --temp 0.05 --system-prompt "You are a helpful assistant to the user." --max-tokens 128000
==========
Yes, cdxgen offers container images for building SBOMs for .NET. Here's a detailed example:

1. **Pull the .NET SBOM container image:**
```bash
docker pull ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet:latest
```

2. **Run the container with your .NET project:**
```bash
docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/app -w /app ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet:latest cdxgen -t dotnet -o sbom.json
```

This command mounts your current directory (which should contain your .NET project) into the container and runs `cdxgen` to generate an SBOM for the .NET project.
==========
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "Does cdxgen offer container images for building sbom for dotnet?" --temp 0.05 --system-prompt "You are a helpful assistant to the user. Always provide a detailed response with examples and reference to the source." --max-tokens 128000
==========
Yes, cdxgen provides container images for building SBOMs for .NET applications.
==========
```

TITLE: Declaring Package Hashes for h2 in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet declares SHA256 hashes to ensure the integrity of the `h2` Python package.  These hashes are used to verify the authenticity of the downloaded package, to prevent malicious packages from being installed.  The declaration has version constraints, working only on python versions from 3.8.1 up to (but not including) 3.12.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/chen-science-requirements.txt#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
h2==4.1.0 ; python_full_version >= "3.8.1" and python_version < "3.12" \
    --hash=sha256:03a46bcf682256c95b5fd9e9a99c1323584c3eec6440d379b9903d709476bc6d \
    --hash=sha256:a83aca08fbe7aacb79fec788c9c0bac936343560ed9ec18b82a13a12c28d2abb
```

TITLE: Running cdxgen with Docker and secure image
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to run cdxgen within a Docker container using the `ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-secure` image. It mounts the /tmp directory and the current working directory as volumes.  It's a convenient way to use cdxgen with pre-configured permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/PERMISSIONS.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-secure cdxgen -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
```

TITLE: Enabling C++ Language and Setting C++ Standard
DESCRIPTION: This snippet includes checks to determine C++ compiler support, enables C++ language if available, and sets the default C++ standard to C++11 if not specified, ensuring C++ features are properly configured for compilation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
include (CheckLanguage)
check_language (CXX)
if (CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER)
   enable_language (CXX)
   if (NOT CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD)
      set (CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 11)
   endif ()
else ()
   message (STATUS "No CXX support")
endif ()
```

TITLE: Generating Test Enumeration Files for CTest Integration Using CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet checks for the test-libmongoc target and generates CMake scripts that load all tests for each build configuration in multi-configuration environments. It ensures that the proper tests are included or warns if the user has not specified a build configuration when required. The generated files are appended to the directory property TEST_INCLUDE_FILES for proper discovery by CTest, facilitating automated and configuration-aware test execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (TARGET test-libmongoc)
   # Generate a file that can be included by CTest to load and enumerate all of the
   # tests defined by the test-libmongoc executable. Generate one for each
   # configuration in case of multiconf generators.
   string (CONFIGURE [=[
      set (TEST_LIBMONGOC_EXE [[$<TARGET_FILE:test-libmongoc>]])
      set (SRC_ROOT [[@PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR@]])
      set (IS_MULTICONF $<BOOL:@CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES@>)
      if (NOT IS_MULTICONF OR CTEST_CONFIGURATION_TYPE STREQUAL "$<CONFIG>")
         # We are not in multi-conf, or the current config matches our config.
         include ("${SRC_ROOT}/build/cmake/LoadTests.cmake")
      elseif (NOT CTEST_CONFIGURATION_TYPE)
         # We are in multi-conf, but no '-C' config was specified
         message (WARNING "Specify a --build-config when using CTest with a multi-config build")
      else ()
         # Do nothing. Not our config.
      endif ()
   ]=] code @ONLY)
   file (GENERATE
         OUTPUT "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/LoadTests-$<CONFIG>.cmake"
         CONTENT "${code}")
   if (CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES)
      foreach (conf IN LISTS CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES)
         # Direct the generated CTest code to include() the file that loads the tests:
         set_property (
            DIRECTORY
            APPEND PROPERTY
            TEST_INCLUDE_FILES "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/LoadTests-${conf}.cmake")
      endforeach ()
   else ()
      set_property (
         DIRECTORY
         APPEND PROPERTY
         TEST_INCLUDE_FILES "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/LoadTests-${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}.cmake")
   endif ()
endif ()
```

TITLE: Defining Package Requirements with Version and Python Compatibility
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates specifying package requirements with version constraints and Python compatibility checks. It uses conditional markers based on `python_full_version`, `python_version`, and `sys_platform` to ensure that the package is only installed when the Python version and platform meet the specified criteria. The hashes associated provide integrity checks on the downloaded package.

    --hash=sha256:d302b3c5b53d47bce91fea46679d9c3c6508cf6332229aa1e7d8653723793386 \
    --hash=sha256:d88e651f9db8d8551a62556d3cff9e3034274ca5d66e93197cf2490e2dcb69c7

TITLE: Running Atom Separately in Java Mode for Large Projects
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for running the Atom slicing tool separately for very large projects (> 1M LOC). Involves downloading and unzipping Atom, then running it with increased memory (`-J-Xmx16g` or more) to generate usage slices for Java or C projects, saving them to a file (e.g., `usages.json`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
unzip atom.zip
cd atom-1.0.0/bin

# Java project
./atom -J-Xmx16g usages -o app.atom --slice-outfile usages.json -l java <path to repo>

# C project
./atom -J-Xmx16g usages -o app.atom --slice-outfile usages.json -l c <path to repo>
```

TITLE: Configuring XNNPACK Delegate Sources and Dependencies in CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet enables and configures the XNNPACK delegate if enabled by locating required headers and libraries, filtering source files to exclude tests and tester implementations, and appending the XNNPACK library to target dependencies. It also defines a compilation flag to signal the inclusion of the XNNPACK delegate, facilitating neural network acceleration with XNNPACK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(TFLITE_ENABLE_XNNPACK)
  find_package(fp16_headers REQUIRED)
  find_package(XNNPACK REQUIRED)
  populate_tflite_source_vars("delegates/xnnpack"
    TFLITE_DELEGATES_XNNPACK_SRCS
    FILTER ".*(_test|_tester)\\.(cc|h)"
  )
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES
    XNNPACK
  )
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_PUBLIC_OPTIONS "-DTFLITE_BUILD_WITH_XNNPACK_DELEGATE")
endif()
```

TITLE: Finding Required TensorFlow Lite Dependencies with CMake
DESCRIPTION: Utilizes the `find_package` command to locate required external dependencies for TFLite. These include absl, Eigen3, farmhash, fft2d, FlatBuffers, gemmlowp, NEON_2_SSE (conditionally on x86 processors), cpuinfo, ml_dtypes, and ruy. The `REQUIRED` keyword ensures that CMake will halt with an error if any of these packages are not found. Found targets (like NEON_2_SSE) are added to the `TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES` list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Additional library dependencies based upon enabled features.
set(TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES "")
# Find TensorFlow Lite dependencies.
find_package(absl REQUIRED)
find_package(Eigen3 REQUIRED)
find_package(farmhash REQUIRED)
find_package(fft2d REQUIRED)
find_package(FlatBuffers REQUIRED)
find_package(gemmlowp REQUIRED)
if (NOT CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR OR CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "x86")
  find_package(NEON_2_SSE REQUIRED)
  list(APPEND TFLITE_TARGET_DEPENDENCIES NEON_2_SSE::NEON_2_SSE)
endif()
find_package(cpuinfo REQUIRED)  #CPUINFO is used by XNNPACK and RUY library
find_package(ml_dtypes REQUIRED)
find_package(ruy REQUIRED)
```

TITLE: Evinse with Cached Slices Generation
DESCRIPTION: Generates evidence while caching usages and data-flow slices for improved performance on subsequent runs. It utilizes `--usages-slices-file` and `--data-flow-slices-file` to specify the locations of the cached slices.  The `--with-data-flow` flag is necessary for callstack evidence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
evinse -i bom.json -o bom.evinse.json --usages-slices-file usages.json --data-flow-slices-file data-flow.json --with-data-flow <path to the application>
```

TITLE: Verify SBOM signature
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to verify the signature of an SBOM using the `cdx-verify` command-line tool. It installs the cdxgen package globally and then uses `cdx-verify` to check the signature of `bom.json` using `public.key`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install -g @cyclonedx/cdxgen
cdx-verify -i bom.json --public-key public.key
```

TITLE: Handling Optional pthreadpool Dependency in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Manages the pthreadpool dependency, which is required by XNNPACK. If the `SYSTEM_PTHREADPOOL` option is set, it searches for a pre-installed library using `find_library`. If not found and `PTHREADPOOL_SOURCE_DIR` is undefined, it downloads the source code using `configure_file` to generate a temporary CMake project and `execute_process` to run CMake commands for downloading. Finally, if not using a system library and the target doesn't exist, it adds the downloaded or specified source directory using `add_subdirectory`, disabling tests and benchmarks within the pthreadpool build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Download necessary dependencies.
# Download pthreadpool source package if it doesn't exist.
if(SYSTEM_PTHREADPOOL)
  find_library(PTHREADPOOL_LIB pthreadpool REQUIRED)
elseif(NOT DEFINED PTHREADPOOL_SOURCE_DIR)
    message(STATUS "Downloading pthreadpool to ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool-source (define SYSTEM_PTHREADPOOL or PTHREADPOOL_SOURCE_DIR to avoid it)")
    configure_file(cmake/DownloadPThreadPool.cmake "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool-download/CMakeLists.txt")
    execute_process(COMMAND "${CMAKE_COMMAND}" -G "${CMAKE_GENERATOR}" .
      WORKING_DIRECTORY "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool-download")
    execute_process(COMMAND "${CMAKE_COMMAND}" --build .
      WORKING_DIRECTORY "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool-download")
    set(PTHREADPOOL_SOURCE_DIR "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool-source" CACHE STRING "pthreadpool source directory")
endif()
# Configure pthreadpool
if(NOT SYSTEM_PTHREADPOOL AND NOT TARGET pthreadpool)
  set(PTHREADPOOL_BUILD_TESTS OFF CACHE BOOL "")
  set(PTHREADPOOL_BUILD_BENCHMARKS OFF CACHE BOOL "")
  set(PTHREADPOOL_ALLOW_DEPRECATED_API OFF CACHE BOOL "")
  add_subdirectory(
    "${PTHREADPOOL_SOURCE_DIR}"
    "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/pthreadpool")
endif()
```

TITLE: Defining Minimum C Standards and POSIX Feature Macros
DESCRIPTION: This snippet ensures a minimum C standard (C99), and defines system macros for POSIX compliance, BSD sources, and BSD visibility depending on system and compiler features, ensuring portable and standards-compliant compilation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if (NOT DEFINED CMAKE_C_STANDARD)
   set (CMAKE_C_STANDARD 99)
endif ()
if (NOT DEFINED CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED)
   set (CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)
endif ()
if (NOT DEFINED CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS)
   set (CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS OFF)
endif ()
```

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/feature_test_macros.7.html
# https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/7908799/xsh/compilation.html
# Enable POSIX features up to POSIX.1-2008 plus the XSI extension and BSD-derived definitions.
# Both _BSD_SOURCE and _DEFAULT_SOURCE are defined for backwards-compatibility with glibc 2.19 and earlier.
# _BSD_SOURCE and _DEFAULT_SOURCE are required by `getpagesize`, `h_errno`, etc.
# _XOPEN_SOURCE=700 is required by `strnlen`, `strerror_l`, etc.
add_definitions (-D_XOPEN_SOURCE=700 -D_BSD_SOURCE -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE)
list (APPEND CMAKE_REQUIRED_DEFINITIONS -D_XOPEN_SOURCE=700 -D_BSD_SOURCE -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE)
```

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Enable non-standard features on FreeBSD with __BSD_VISIBLE=1
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "FreeBSD")
   add_definitions (-D__BSD_VISIBLE=1)
   list (APPEND CMAKE_REQUIRED_DEFINITIONS -D__BSD_VISIBLE=1)
endif ()
```

TITLE: Setting Install Targets for TFLite
DESCRIPTION: This code defines install targets for the TFLite library, headers, and configuration files, allowing the built library to be installed to a specified directory. It uses the `TFLITE_ENABLE_INSTALL` flag to determine if install targets should be configured. It installs the library, headers and CMake configuration files. Dependencies are ${PROJECT_NAME} and the previously created `tensorflow-lite` target.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# The install targets.
if(TFLITE_ENABLE_INSTALL)
  install(
    TARGETS tensorflow-lite
    EXPORT ${PROJECT_NAME}Targets
    LIBRARY DESTINATION ${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}
    ARCHIVE DESTINATION ${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}
  )

  foreach(hdr ${_ALL_TFLITE_HDRS})
    get_filename_component(dir ${hdr} DIRECTORY)
    file(RELATIVE_PATH dir ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR} ${dir})
    install(
      FILES ${hdr}
      DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/tensorflow/lite/${dir}"
    )
  endforeach()

  install(
    EXPORT ${PROJECT_NAME}Targets
    NAMESPACE ${PROJECT_NAME}::
    DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME}"
  )

  # Generate config file that's used by find_package(tensorflow-lite CONFIG).

  include(CMakePackageConfigHelpers)

  configure_package_config_file(
    "tools/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME}Config.cmake.in"
    "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/${PROJECT_NAME}Config.cmake"
    INSTALL_DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME}"
  )

  install(FILES "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/${PROJECT_NAME}Config.cmake"
    DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME}"
  )
endif()
```

TITLE: Executing Commands with cloud-config
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains a series of commands executed during the cloud-config initialization. It includes adding user to docker group, disabling system services, enabling fail2ban, configuring ufw, hardening SSH configuration, setting environment variables, installing Swift, NodeJS and Nydus.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/cloud-init.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
runcmd:
  - adduser ubuntu docker
  - sysctl vm.swappiness=0
  - echo "vm.swappiness = 0" | tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf
  - systemctl disable man-db.timer man-db.service --now
  - systemctl disable apport.service apport-autoreport.service  --now
  - systemctl disable apt-daily.service apt-daily.timer --now
  - systemctl disable apt-daily-upgrade.service apt-daily-upgrade.timer --now
  - systemctl disable unattended-upgrades.service --now
  - systemctl disable motd-news.service motd-news.timer --now
  - systemctl disable bluetooth.target --now
  - systemctl disable ua-messaging.service ua-messaging.timer --now
  - systemctl enable fail2ban
  - ufw allow OpenSSH
  - ufw enable
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)PermitRootLogin/s/^.*$/PermitRootLogin no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)PasswordAuthentication/s/^.*$/PasswordAuthentication no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)KbdInteractiveAuthentication/s/^.*$/KbdInteractiveAuthentication no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)ChallengeResponseAuthentication/s/^.*$/ChallengeResponseAuthentication no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)MaxAuthTries/s/^.*$/MaxAuthTries 3/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)AllowTcpForwarding/s/^.*$/AllowTcpForwarding no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)X11Forwarding/s/^.*$/X11Forwarding no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)AllowAgentForwarding/s/^.*$/AllowAgentForwarding no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i -e '/^\(#\|\)AuthorizedKeysFile/s/^.*$/AuthorizedKeysFile .ssh\/authorized_keys/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - sed -i '$a AllowUsers ubuntu' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
  - export SWIFT_SIGNING_KEY=52BB7E3DE28A71BE22EC05FFEF80A866B47A981F
  - export SWIFT_PLATFORM=ubuntu24.04
  - export SWIFT_BRANCH=swift-6.1-release
  - export SWIFT_VERSION=swift-6.1-RELEASE
  - export SWIFT_WEBROOT=https://download.swift.org
  - export OS_ARCH_SUFFIX='-aarch64'
  - export SWIFT_WEBDIR="$SWIFT_WEBROOT/$SWIFT_BRANCH/$(echo $SWIFT_PLATFORM | tr -d .)$OS_ARCH_SUFFIX"
  - SWIFT_BIN_URL="$SWIFT_WEBDIR/$SWIFT_VERSION/$SWIFT_VERSION-$SWIFT_PLATFORM$OS_ARCH_SUFFIX.tar.gz"
  - SWIFT_SIG_URL="$SWIFT_BIN_URL.sig"
  - GNUPGHOME="$(mktemp -d)"
  - curl -fsSL "$SWIFT_BIN_URL" -o swift.tar.gz "$SWIFT_SIG_URL" -o swift.tar.gz.sig
  - gpg --batch --quiet --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys "$SWIFT_SIGNING_KEY"
  - gpg --batch --verify swift.tar.gz.sig swift.tar.gz
  - tar -xzf swift.tar.gz --directory / --strip-components=1
  - chmod -R o+r /usr/lib/swift
  - apt-get autoremove -y
  - curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_23.x -o nodesource_setup.sh
  - bash nodesource_setup.sh
  - apt install -y nodejs
  - rm nodesource_setup.sh
  - export ARCH_NAME="$(dpkg --print-architecture)"
  - curl -LO https://github.com/dragonflyoss/nydus/releases/download/v2.3.1/nydus-static-v2.3.1-linux-${ARCH_NAME}.tgz
  - tar -xvf nydus-static-v2.3.1-linux-${ARCH_NAME}.tgz
  - chmod +x nydus-static/*
  - mv nydus-static/* /usr/local/bin/
  - rm -rf nydus-static-v2.3.1-linux-${ARCH_NAME}.tgz nydus-static
```

TITLE: Custom SBOM Signature Verification (Node.js)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to verify an SBOM signature using the `jws` library in Node.js. It reads the BOM JSON file and the public key, retrieves the signature from the BOM, and then verifies the signature using the public key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
# npm install jws
const jws = require("jws");
const fs = require("fs");
// Location of the SBOM json file
const bomJsonFile = "bom.json";
// Location of the public key
const publicKeyFile = "public.key";
const bomJson = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(bomJsonFile, "utf8"));
// Retrieve the signature
const bomSignature = bomJson.signature.value;
const validationResult = jws.verify(bomSignature, bomJson.signature.algorithm, fs.readFileSync(publicKeyFile, "utf8"));
if (validationResult) {
  console.log("Signature is valid!");
} else {
  console.log("SBOM signature is invalid :(");
}
```

TITLE: Platform-Specific Library Linking and Feature Checks in CMake - CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet manages required and optional library linking and compiler flags based on the detected build platform. It ensures multithreading support via the Threads package, adds platform-specific link libraries (e.g., ws2_32 for Windows, librt for Linux), handles required coverage flags, and propagates linking information for correct builds and pkg-config integration. The snippet is designed to abstract system dependencies for portability and reproducibility; required dependencies vary by platform. Inputs are detected platform variables and feature flags; outputs are link settings and exported properties consumed during target configuration and installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(ENABLE_COVERAGE)
   mongo_platform_link_options(--coverage)
   mongo_platform_compile_options($<BUILD_INTERFACE:--coverage>)
endif()

# Enable multi-threading:
set(THREADS_PREFER_PTHREAD_FLAG TRUE)
find_package(Threads REQUIRED)
mongo_platform_use_target(Threads::Threads)

if(WIN32)
   # Required for gethostbyname on Windows:
   mongo_platform_link_libraries(ws2_32)
endif()

# librt needed on linux for clock_gettime
find_library(RT_LIBRARY rt PATHS /usr/lib32)
if(RT_LIBRARY)
   mongo_platform_link_libraries(${RT_LIBRARY})
   # Set required libraries for CHECK_FUNCTION_EXISTS
   list(APPEND CMAKE_REQUIRED_LIBRARIES "${RT_LIBRARY}")
   # Export the rt linkage as a pkg-config property:
   get_filename_component(rt_dir "${RT_LIBRARY}" DIRECTORY)
   set_property(DIRECTORY APPEND PROPERTY pkg_config_LIBS "-L${rt_dir}" -lrt)
endif()

```

TITLE: Setting Up Metal Delegate Libraries and Headers in CMake for Darwin Objective-C++
DESCRIPTION: This snippet enables Objective-C++ language support for Darwin platforms when Metal delegate support is enabled. It configures the Metal delegate static library creation, sets include directories, and generates Flatbuffers headers required by the delegate. Additionally, it defines and builds supplementary Metal-related static libraries from source files with appropriate compiler properties, facilitating GPU delegate support with the Metal framework on Apple platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(TFLITE_ENABLE_METAL AND "${CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME}" STREQUAL "Darwin")
  enable_language(OBJCXX)
  list(APPEND TFLITE_DELEGATES_METAL_SRCS
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal_delegate.mm
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/buffer.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/buffer_convert.mm
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/common.mm
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/compute_task.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/inference_context.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/metal_arguments.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/metal_device.cc
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/metal_spatial_tensor.cc
  )
  add_library(metal_delegate STATIC
    ${TFLITE_DELEGATES_METAL_SRCS}
  )
  target_include_directories(metal_delegate PUBLIC
    ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/abseil-cpp
    ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/flatbuffers/include
    PRIVATE ${TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR}
  )
  if(FLATBUFFERS_FLATC_EXECUTABLE)
    set(FLATC ${FLATBUFFERS_FLATC_EXECUTABLE})
  else()
    set(FLATC flatc)
  endif()
  add_custom_command(
      OUTPUT ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/inference_context_generated.h
      COMMAND ${FLATC} --scoped-enums
      -I ${TENSORFLOW_SOURCE_DIR}
      -o ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal
      -c ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/inference_context.fbs
  )
  add_custom_target(
      inference_context_cc_fbs
      DEPENDS ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/inference_context_generated.h
  )
  add_dependencies(metal_delegate inference_context_cc_fbs)
  list(APPEND CC_SRCS
      buffer
      compute_task
      inference_context
      metal_arguments
      metal_device
      metal_spatial_tensor
  )
  SET(METAL_DELEGATE_PATH ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/delegates/gpu/metal/)
  foreach(lib_name ${CC_SRCS})
    set_source_files_properties(${METAL_DELEGATE_PATH}${lib_name}.cc  PROPERTIES LANGUAGE OBJCXX)
    add_library("${lib_name}" STATIC ${METAL_DELEGATE_PATH}${lib_name}.cc)
    target_include_directories("${lib_name}" PUBLIC
      ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/abseil-cpp
      ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/flatbuffers/include
    )
    set_target_properties(${lib_name} PROPERTIES LINKER_LANGUAGE OBJCXX)
    target_link_libraries(${lib_name})
  endforeach()
  list(APPEND MM_SRCS
    buffer_convert
    common
  )
  foreach(lib_name ${MM_SRCS})
    add_library("${lib_name}" STATIC ${METAL_DELEGATE_PATH}${lib_name}.mm)
    target_include_directories("${lib_name}" PUBLIC
      ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/abseil-cpp
      ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/flatbuffers/include
    )
    target_link_libraries(${lib_name})
  endforeach()
endif()
```

TITLE: Setting Profiler Source Files
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a CMake variable `TFLITE_PROFILER_SRCS` and populates it with source files related to profiling, including platform-specific implementations. It uses `if` statements to append Android and iOS specific source files.  Dependencies: CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME, TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
set(TFLITE_PROFILER_SRCS
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/platform_profiler.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/root_profiler.h
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/root_profiler.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/telemetry/profiler.cc
  ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/telemetry/telemetry.cc
)
if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "Android")
  list(APPEND TFLITE_PROFILER_SRCS
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/atrace_profiler.cc
  )
elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES "iOS")
  enable_language(OBJCXX)
  list(APPEND TFLITE_PROFILER_SRCS
    ${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/signpost_profiler.mm
  )
  set_source_files_properties(${TFLITE_SOURCE_DIR}/profiling/signpost_profiler.mm PROPERTIES COMPILE_FLAGS -fno-objc-arc)
endif()
```

DESCRIPTION: This line specifies a dependency on the Python package `custom-json-diff`. The `~=` operator indicates a compatible release specification, requiring a version greater than or equal to 2.1.0 and less than 2.2.0. This ensures that bugfix releases are allowed, but features that might break backward compatibility are not included.

TITLE: Using cdxgen as a Library in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Provides a basic example demonstrating how to import and use the `createBom` and `submitBom` functions from the cdxgen library in a Node.js environment (version >= 20 required for ESM). It shows how to generate and then potentially submit a BOM programmatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createBom, submitBom } from "@cyclonedx/cdxgen";
// bomNSData would contain bomJson
const bomNSData = await createBom(filePath, options);
// Submission to dependency track server
const dbody = await submitBom(args, bomNSData.bomJson);
```

TITLE: Generating JSONL from JSON Schema using Gemini Prompt (Text)
DESCRIPTION: This prompt instructs Google Gemini to convert JSON Schema files into a plain text JSON Lines format using the specified chat template. It requires understanding schema attributes like title, description, and examples to generate questions a user might ask about each property and provide long explanations as answers. Double quotes must be escaped, and the output should be plain text JSON lines without commas or list structures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/fine-tuning/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
you are an expert in converting json schema files to a single plain text jsonlines format based on the my template. {"messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "<user_question>"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "<detailed_explanation>"}]}. Understand the contents of the json schema file by reading attributes such as title, description, examples. Generate all possible questions a user might ask about a given property and a long explanation to answer the question. Substitute "user_question" with your generated question and "detailed_explanation" with your generated explanation. Escape double quotes with a backslash \ to make each line a valid json. Generate a plain text response of json line by line without any commas or list. I will start uploading the json files in the rest of the chat session. generate a single plain text response without any markdown formatting for the entire response.
```

TITLE: Evinse JavaScript/TypeScript Evidence Generation
DESCRIPTION: Generates evidence for JavaScript or TypeScript projects by passing the `-l javascript` flag to the `evinse` command. It also utilizes `--usages-slices-file` and `--data-flow-slices-file` to specify the locations of the cached slices.  The `--with-data-flow` flag is used to generate callstack evidence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
evinse -i bom.json -o bom.evinse.json --usages-slices-file usages.json --data-flow-slices-file data-flow.json -l javascript --with-data-flow <path to the application>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Picking Configuration Flags for BSON and RDTSCP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses custom functions to select whether optional features like extra alignment and RDTSCP are enabled, based on default values, controlling additional build features conditionally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
_mongo_pick(BSON_EXTRA_ALIGN 1 0 ENABLE_EXTRA_ALIGNMENT)

_mongo_pick(MONGOC_ENABLE_RDTSCP 1 0 ENABLE_RDTSCP)

_mongo_pick(MONGOC_ENABLE_STATIC_BUILD 1 0 ENABLE_STATIC)
_mongo_pick(MONGOC_ENABLE_STATIC_INSTALL 1 0
            [[ENABLE_STATIC AND NOT ENABLE_STATIC STREQUAL "BUILD_ONLY"]])
```

actions {

}

TITLE: Complete Example for Setting Up and Running Snapshot Comparison Tests
DESCRIPTION: A complete example workflow showing how to download original snapshots, extract comparison files, set up a Python virtual environment, and run the difference testing script to compare CycloneDX BOMs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/diff/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl https://github.com/AppThreat/cdxgen-samples/archive/refs/heads/main.zip -o original_snapshots.zip
unzip original_snapshots.zip
unzip cdxgen_boms.zip -d new_snapshots # downloaded workflow artifact from github
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
pip3 install custom-json-diff
python3 test/diff/diff_tests.py -d original_snapshots new_snapshots
```

TITLE: Including .NET Global Assembly Cache Dependencies with Directory.Build.props
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for a Directory.Build.props file that ensures Global Assembly Cache dependencies are copied to the build directory for version detection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
<ItemDefinitionGroup>
  <Reference>
    <Private>True</Private>
  </Reference>
</ItemDefinitionGroup>
</Project>
```

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Ruby 2.6.0 (Debian) Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for Ruby 2.6.0 applications using the Debian-based cdxgen-debian-ruby26 image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby26:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
```

TITLE: Scanning Git Repo via HTTP API (GET)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to initiate a scan of a git repository by making a GET request to the cdxgen HTTP API endpoint. The repository URL, multi-project flag, and project type are passed as query parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Container SBOM on Windows using cdxgen
DESCRIPTION: Generates an SBOM for a Linux container image on a Windows host using cdxgen. Requires specific prerequisites: `cdxgen-plugins-bin` > 1.4.0 installed, Docker Desktop running as admin with TCP daemon exposed, and PowerShell running as admin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen -t docker -o bom.json <image name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing .NET GAC Assemblies using Docker (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Runs the 'gacutil -l' command inside a Debian .NET 6 Docker container to list assemblies in the Global Assembly Cache. Requires Docker, mounts the current directory to /app and /tmp to /tmp within the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -w /app -it ghcr.io/cyclonedx/debian-dotnet6:master gacutil -l
```

TITLE: Citing the CycloneDX/cdxgen Models (BibTeX)
DESCRIPTION: This BibTeX entry provides the standard citation format for the fine-tuned CycloneDX and cdxgen models (e.g., cdx1) hosted on Hugging Face. It includes the authors, title, publication source (URL), month, and year.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/fine-tuning/README.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bibtex
CODE:
```
@misc{cdx1,
  author = {OWASP CycloneDX Generator Team},
  month = Feb,
  title = {{CycloneDX and cdxgen}},
  howpublished = {{https://huggingface.co/models/CycloneDX/cdx1}},
  year = {2025}
}
```

TITLE: Generating Shell Command Completions for cdxgen/evinse
DESCRIPTION: Generates command completion scripts for bash or zsh shells for tools like cdxgen and evinse. The output should be appended to the respective shell configuration file (`~/.zshrc` or `~/.bashrc`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cdxgen completion >> ~/.zshrc

# cdxgen completion >> ~/.bashrc

# evinse completion >> ~/.zshrc
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scan a private git repo with cURL using username and password
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to scan a private git repository using cURL by providing username and password in the URL for Bitbucket repositories. Replace <username> and <password> with valid credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/README.md#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<username>:<password>@bitbucket.org/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Ruby 1.8 Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Second step of a two-part workflow for Ruby 1.8 applications, running cdxgen using the ruby25 image with the gems installed in the previous step.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -e CDXGEN_GEM_HOME=/tmp/gems -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-ruby25:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby --lifecycle pre-build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Custom JSON Diff on CycloneDX BOMs
DESCRIPTION: Example command for using custom-json-diff to compare two CycloneDX BOMs with specific filtering options. This command includes component properties, licenses, and evidence while allowing new versions and extra data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/diff/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cjd -i bom1.json bom2.json -o diffs.json bom-diff --include-extra properties,licenses,evidence -anv -and
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: CMake Project Setup
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up a basic CMake project. It specifies the minimum CMake version required, declares the project name and version, and adds an executable named 'myexample' that is built from the 'example.cpp' source file. The project version is set to 2.1.3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists-version.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.15)

project(MyProject VERSION 2.1.3)

add_executable(myexample example.cpp)
```

TITLE: Using Atom for Large-Scale SBOM Generation with Code Analysis
DESCRIPTION: Process for generating SBOMs for very large projects using the Atom tool. Involves downloading Atom, running it with sufficient memory allocation to generate slices, then using cdxgen with the generated slices file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
unzip atom.zip
cd atom-1.0.0/bin
./atom -J-Xmx16g usages -o app.atom --slice-outfile usages.json -l c <path to repo>
node bin/cdxgen.js -o bom.json -t c --usages-slices-file usages.json <path to repo>
```

TITLE: Running CDXGEN for Python 3.6 Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker command to generate SBOM for Python 3.6 applications, which only supports direct dependencies without a dependency tree.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=verbose -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python36:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
```
