TITLE: Defining and Validating Build Feature Options with mongo_bool_setting and mongo_setting - CMake
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses custom CMake functions (mongo_bool_setting, mongo_setting) to declare, document, and set defaults for various build-time and feature toggles such as enabling the mongoc library, use of external libbson, static/dynamic library compilation, tests, examples, SSL/TLS, authentication, and compression features. It enforces cross-option dependencies and validates allowed platform/feature combinations (e.g., SSL and SASL types, platform constraints, deprecated options). Prerequisites: the custom CMake helper scripts and functions are required. Inputs include user-provided or cached options; outputs are internal CMake variables consumed during build. Constraints and validation logic prevent unsupported or deprecated configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Subcomponents:
mongo_bool_setting(ENABLE_MONGOC "Enable the build of libmongoc libraries (The MongoDB C database driver)")
mongo_bool_setting(
   USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON [[Use an existing libbson library (via find_package()) instead of building one from source]]
   DEFAULT VALUE OFF
   ADVANCED
)

# Deprecated option "ENABLE_BSON" is gone, but old caches may rely on SYSTEM to
disable the libbson build. Allow ENABLE_BSON=SYSTEM only if USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON
is also true, to allow both ENABLE_BSON=SYSTEM and USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON=TRUE to
simplify downstream build scripts
if(ENABLE_BSON STREQUAL "SYSTEM" AND NOT USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON)
   # User set ENABLE_BSON=SYSTEM, so they intend for us to build against an external
   # libbson, but they didn't set USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON=ON, so they are probably
   # unaware of this change. Rather than miscompile, stop what we're doing:
   message(FATAL_ERROR "ENABLE_BSON=SYSTEM is no longer supported. Use USE_SYSTEM_LIBBSON=ON for the same effect.")
endif()

# Toggle static libraries:
mongo_setting(
   ENABLE_STATIC "Enable building and installing static library archive artifacts"
   OPTIONS ON OFF BUILD_ONLY
   DEFAULT VALUE "ON"
)
# Toggle dynamic libraries:
mongo_bool_setting(ENABLE_SHARED "Enable building and installing dynamic library artifacts")

# PIC toggle and platform validation...
# (Further feature flags follow in similar fashion, omitted from code for brevity)
```

TITLE: Populating Source Variables for TFLite Kernels
DESCRIPTION: This snippet calls the `populate_tflite_source_vars` function to populate variables containing source files for different TFLite kernel implementations. It passes the path to the kernel directory and the name of the variable to be populated as arguments. The second call includes a filter, using a regular expression, to exclude specific files based on their filename.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
populate_tflite_source_vars("kernels/internal/optimized/sparse_ops"
  TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_OPT_SPARSE_OPS_SRCS
)
populate_tflite_source_vars("kernels/internal/reference"
  TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_REF_SRCS
)
populate_tflite_source_vars("kernels/internal/reference/integer_ops"
  TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_REF_INTEGER_OPS_SRCS
)
populate_tflite_source_vars("kernels/internal/reference/sparse_ops"
  TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_REF_SPARSE_OPS_SRCS
)
populate_tflite_source_vars("kernels/internal/optimized/4bit"
  TFLITE_KERNEL_INTERNAL_OPT_4BIT_SRCS
  FILTER "(.*neon.*|.*sse.*)\.(cc|h)"
)

TITLE: Setting Directories and Enabling Testing
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the source directory, includes testing modules, and configures RPATH and installation options to facilitate correct runtime paths and testing behavior across platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
set (BUILD_SOURCE_DIR ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR})

# Enable CTest
include (CTest)
if (BUILD_TESTING)
   include (TestFixtures)
endif ()

# Ensure the default behavior: don't ignore RPATH settings.
set (CMAKE_SKIP_BUILD_RPATH OFF)

# Ensure the default behavior: don't use the final install destination as the
# temporary RPATH for executables (ensure we can run tests and programs from
# the build directory).
set (CMAKE_BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH OFF)

# Include any custom library paths in the final RPATH.
set (CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH_USE_LINK_PATH ON)

# Install libs with names like @rpath/libmongoc-1.0.0.dylib, not bare names.
set (CMAKE_MACOSX_RPATH ON)

# https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.11/policy/CMP0042.html
# Enable a CMake 3.0+ policy that sets CMAKE_MACOSX_RPATH by default, and
# silence a CMake 3.11 warning that the old behavior is deprecated.
cmake_policy (SET CMP0042 NEW)
```

TITLE: Generating CycloneDX BOM Response with mlx_lm (Helpful Assistant)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet generates an answer using the mlx_lm model regarding the 'bomFormat' property. It specifies a system prompt that casts the model as a helpful assistant to the user. The response is expected to clearly define the property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/xBOMEval/cdx1-NOTES.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "What is the purpose of the bomFormat property in a CycloneDX BOM?" --temp 0.05 --system-prompt "You are a helpful assistant to the user."
==========
```

TITLE: Generating CycloneDX BOM Response with mlx_lm (Alternative System Prompt)
DESCRIPTION: Similar to the previous snippet, this uses mlx_lm to generate a response about the 'bomFormat' property.  The key difference is the system prompt. The purpose is to assess how changing the system prompt impacts the generated response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/contrib/xBOMEval/cdx1-NOTES.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
mlx_lm.generate --model ./CycloneDX/cdx1-mlx-8bit --prompt "What is the purpose of the bomFormat property in a CycloneDX BOM?" --temp 0.05 --system-prompt "You are cdxgen, an helpful assistant."
==========
```

TITLE: Generating SBOM with research profile
DESCRIPTION: This command generates an SBOM in JSON format using cdxgen with the research profile. The command is executed within the Dependency-Track directory and includes occurrence and call stack evidence in the resulting BOM file. The `-p` flag enables reachable evidence generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/docs/LESSON1.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd dependency-track
# Takes around 5 mins
cdxgen -o bom.json -t java --profile research . -p
```

TITLE: Configuring Warning Options for Maintainers
DESCRIPTION: This section conditionally adds compiler warning flags aimed at maintainers if the flag 'ENABLE_MAINTAINER_FLAGS' is set, promoting strict code standards and highlighting potential issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/test/data/cmakes/CMakeLists.txt#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
if(ENABLE_MAINTAINER_FLAGS)
   mongoc_add_warning_options(
      gnu-like:-Werror
      gnu-like:-pedantic
      gnu-like:-Wall
      gnu-like:-Wempty-body
      gnu:not-gcc-lt7:-Wexpansion-to-defined
      gnu-like:-Wformat
      gnu-like:-Wformat-nonliteral
      gnu-like:-Wformat-security
      gnu-like:-Winit-self
      gnu-like:-Wmissing-include-dirs
      gnu-like:-Wredundant-decls
      gnu-like:-Wshadow
      gnu-like:lang-c:-Wstrict-prototypes
      gnu-like:-Wswitch-default
      gnu-like:-Wswitch-enum
      gnu-like:-Wundef
      gnu-like:-Wuninitialized
      # Disabled, for now:
      gnu-like:-Wno-strict-aliasing
   )
endif()
```

TITLE: Running Bundle Install for Ruby 1.8 Applications with Docker
DESCRIPTION: First step of a two-part workflow for Ruby 1.8 applications, performing bundle install using the debian-ruby18 image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen/blob/master/ci/base-images/README.md#_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp:rw -e GEM_HOME=/tmp/gems -v $(pwd):/app:rw -w /app -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/debian-ruby18:master bundle install
```
